SERVICE SPECIFICATIONS
ItemStandard value
Wheel speed sensor current mA5 - 9 or 11 - 17
Wheel speed sensor insulation resistance MΩ1.5 or more

35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS TROUBLESHOOTING FLOW
STANDARD FLOW OF DIAGNOSTIC TROUBLESHOOTING
Refer to GROUP 00, How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points .
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > NOTES WITH REGARD TO DIAGNOSIS
NOTES WITH REGARD TO DIAGNOSIS
1. The Active Stability & Traction Control system (ASTC) is a system which controls the brake pressure and engine power by means of the operation of the ECU. Accordingly, the following symptoms may occur at times, but these are a sign of normal ASTC operation, and do not indicate a malfunction.
PhenomenonExplanation of phenomenon
When the engine starts, a knocking sound can be heard coming from the engine compartment.This sound occurs as a result of system operation checking, and is not a malfunction.
Although the accelerator pedal is depressed, the engine speed does not increase or drops.This occurs as a result of the Active Stability Control system (ASC) or Active Traction Control system (ATC) operation, and is not a malfunction.
  • Sound of the motor inside the hydraulic unit operation. (whine)
  • When ASTC operates, sound is generated from the vehicle chassis due to repeated brake application and release. (Thump: suspension; squeak: tyres)
This is the sound of normal system operation, and is not a malfunction.
Shocks are felt if the brake pedal is depressed when driving at low speed.This is due to system operation checking (starting-of check when the vehicle speed reaches a certain number of km/h) and is not a malfunction.
2. ASTC is system for assisting driver's operation. Accordingly, advise the customer to drive safely on such roads by lowering the vehicle speed and not being too overconfident.
3. Diagnosis detection condition can vary depending on the diagnosis code. Make sure that checking requirements listed in the "Comment" are satisfied when checking the trouble symptom again.
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > BRAKE WARNING LAMP, ABS WARNING LAMP, ASTC INDICATOR LAMP, ASTC OFF INDICATOR LAMP INSPECTION<VEHICLES WITH MONO-COLOUR LIQUID CRYSTAL DISPLAY T>
BRAKE WARNING LAMP, ABS WARNING LAMP, ASTC INDICATOR LAMP, ASTC OFF INDICATOR LAMP INSPECTION <VEHICLES WITH MONO-COLOUR LIQUID CRYSTAL DISPLAY TYPE COMBINATION METER>
Check that Anti-lock Brake System (ABS) warning lamp, brake warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp and ASTC OFF indicator lamp illuminate as follows.
noteThe brake warning lamp is used as a warning lamp for parking brake, brake fluid level, and Electronic brake-force distribution (EBD) control.
1. When the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position, ABS warning lamps, brake warning lamps, ASTC indicator lamp and ASTC OFF indicator lamp illuminate.
2. The ABS warning lamps, brake warning lamps, ASTC indicator lamp and ASTC OFF indicator lamp illuminate for three seconds*1 and then turn "OFF"*2.
3. Otherwise, check the diagnosis code.
note
  • *1: The ABS warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp may stay ON until the vehicle speed reaches 25 km/h. As far as ASTC-ECU sets any diagnosis code related to the wheel speed sensor malfunction or the motor malfunction as past trouble, ASTC-ECU continues illuminating the ABS warning lamp until it verifies that the malfunction for that code is resolved (startup check).
    If the steering wheel sensor or the G and yaw rate sensor system was detected to be defective during ignition switch being "ON" at the last time, the ASTC indicator lamp will illuminate until the vehicle speed reaches approximately 25 km/h, then the steering wheel is turned to either right or left and then the ECU determines that the system is normal.
  • *2: The brake warning lamp does not turn OFF when the parking brake is applied or the brake fluid level is lowered.
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > BRAKE WARNING LAMP, ABS WARNING LAMP, ASTC INDICATOR LAMP, ASTC OFF INDICATOR LAMP INSPECTION<VEHICLES WITH COLOUR LIQUID CRYSTAL DISPLAY TYPE C>
BRAKE WARNING LAMP, ABS WARNING LAMP, ASTC INDICATOR LAMP, ASTC OFF INDICATOR LAMP, HDC INDICATOR LAMP INSPECTION <VEHICLES WITH COLOUR LIQUID CRYSTAL DISPLAY TYPE COMBINATION METER>
Check that brake warning lamp, ABS warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp, ASTC OFF indicator lamp and HDC indicator lamp illuminate as follows.
noteThe brake warning lamp is used as a warning lamp for parking brake, brake fluid level, and EBD control.
1. When the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position, ABS warning lamp, brake warning lamps, ASTC indicator lamp, ASTC OFF indicator lamp and HDC indicator lamp <vehicles with HDC function> illuminate.
2. The ABS warning lamps, brake warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp, ASTC OFF indicator lamp and HDC indicator lamp illuminate for three seconds*1 and then turn off*2.
3. Otherwise, check the diagnosis code.
note
  • *1: The ABS warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp may stay ON until the vehicle speed reaches 25 km/h. As far as ASTC-ECU sets any diagnosis code related to the wheel speed sensor malfunction or the motor malfunction as past trouble, ASTC-ECU continues illuminating the ABS warning lamp until it verifies that the malfunction for that diagnosis code is resolved (startup check).
    If the steering wheel sensor or the G and yaw rate sensor system was detected to be defective during ignition switch being "ON" at the last time, the ASTC indicator lamp will illuminate until the vehicle speed reaches approximately 25 km/h, then the steering wheel is turned to either right or left and then the ECU determines that the system is normal.
  • *2: The brake warning lamp does not turn off when the parking brake is applied or the brake fluid level is lowered.
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS FUNCTION
DIAGNOSTIC FUNCTION
ASTC-ECU has the following functions for easier system checks.
  • Diagnosis code set (Refer to ).
  • Data list output (Refer to ).
  • Actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Freeze frame data output (Refer to ).
All the above items can be diagnosed using M.U.T.-III.
 
 
Check of Freeze Frame Data
The freeze frame data can be checked by using the M.U.T.-III.
When detecting fault and setting the diagnosis code, the ECU connected to CAN bus line obtains the data before the determination of the diagnosis code and the data when the diagnosis code is determined, and then stores the ECU status of that time. By analysing each data from M.U.T.-III, the troubleshooting can be performed more efficiently. The displayed items are as the table below.
Display item list
Item No.Item nameData itemUnit
1OdometerTotal driving distance after the diagnosis code is generatedkm
2Ignition cycleNumber of times the ignition switch is turned "ON" or "LOCK" (OFF) after the past failure transitionNumber of counts is displayed.
4Accumulated minuteCumulative time for current malfunction of diagnosis codemin
5FL wheel ABS controlFL wheel ABS control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
6FR wheel ABS controlFR wheel ABS control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
7RL wheel ABS controlRL wheel ABS control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
8RR wheel ABS controlRR wheel ABS control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
9EBD controlEBD control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-

11Engine TCL controlEngine control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
12Engine A.S.C. controlEngine control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
13FL wheel TCL brake controlFL wheel traction control operation status (brake control) when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
14FR wheel TCL brake controlFR wheel traction control operation status (brake control) when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
15RL wheel TCL brake controlRL wheel traction control operation status (brake control) when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
16RR wheel TCL brake controlRR wheel traction control operation status (brake control) when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
17FL wheel A.S.C. brake controlFL wheel ASC control when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-

27Stop lamp switchStop lamp switch condition when the diagnosis code is generated: OFF/ON-
28Power supply voltageVoltage of power supply when the diagnosis code is generatedV
29Longitudinal G sensorLongitudinal G of G and yaw rate sensor when the diagnosis code is generatedG
30Lateral G sensorLateral G of G and yaw rate sensor when the diagnosis code is generatedG

32Yaw rate sensorYaw rate of G and yaw rate sensor when the diagnosis code is generateddeg/s
33Master cylinder pressureMaster cylinder pressure of Master cylinder pressure sensor when the diagnosis code is generatedMPa
34FL wheel speed sensorWheel speed (FL) when the diagnosis code is generatedkm/h
35FR wheel speed sensorWheel speed (FR) when the diagnosis code is generatedkm/h
36RL wheel speed sensorWheel speed (RL) when the diagnosis code is generatedkm/h
37RR wheel speed sensorWheel speed (RR) when the diagnosis code is generatedkm/h
38Engine speedEngine speed when the diagnosis code is generatedr/min
39HDC statusHDC operation status when the diagnosis code is generated-
40Off-road modeOff-road mode status when the diagnosis code is generated-
noteFor vehicles without the system of each item, the data item is displayed but the data differs from the actual vehicle condition is displayed.
 
 
Fail-safe Functions
When a malfunction is determined by the diagnostic function, ASTC-ECU illuminates the brake warning lamp, ABS warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp and ASTC OFF indicator lamp. At the same time, ASTC-ECU prohibits the ABS, EBD, BA, ATC, ASC, HSA, TSA, Emergency Stop Signal system (ESS), FCM, HDC and AS&G BH.
noteThe brake warning lamp is used as the EBD control warning lamp.

  • *5: Vehicles with 4WD.

  • *9: Vehicles with A/T.
  • *10: Vehicles with HDC function-M/T.
  • *11: Vehicles with FCM.
  • *12: Vehicles with HDC function.
  • *13: Vehicles with AS&G system-A/T.

U0428SAS (CAN message)EnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibited

U1015*8FCM/LDW/AHB parity/toggle bitEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedEnabledEnabled
U1073Bus-offProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1100Engine-ECU timeout errorEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1101*10A/T-ECU timeout errorEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibited

U1108Meter CAN timeoutEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedEnabledEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1109ETACS-ECU CAN timeoutProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1118*5Transfer-ECU timeout errorProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1195Coding not completedProhibited*7EnabledProhibited*7Prohibited*7Prohibited*7Prohibited*7Prohibited*7Prohibited*7Prohibited*7Prohibited*7Prohibited*7
U1197Coding errorProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1211ENG parity/toggle bit errorEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1406Accelerator pedal position errorEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U1419SAS dynamic range errorEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedProhibitedEnabledProhibitedProhibitedProhibited
U15A5*8FCM/LDW/AHB CAN timeoutEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledEnabledProhibitedEnabledEnabled
note
  • *1: Disables when the system is defective on both rear wheels.
  • *2: This diagnosis code is not set within the vehicle speed of 30 km/h or less.
  • *3: M/T.
  • *4: Vehicles with rear differential lock.
  • *5: 4WD.
  • *6: Vehicles with HDC function-M/T.
  • *7: Enabled in some cases.
  • *8: Vehicles with FCM.
  • *9: Vehicles with HDC function.
  • *10: A/T.
  • *11: Vehicles with AS&G system-A/T.
 
 
HOW TO READ DIAGNOSIS CODE
Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting and Inspection Service Points .
 
 
HOW TO ERASE DIAGNOSIS CODE
Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting and Inspection Service Points .
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE CHART
DIAGNOSIS CODE CHART
 
 
cautionDuring diagnosis, a diagnosis code associated with other system may be set when the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position with connector(s) disconnected. On completion, confirm all systems for diagnosis code(s). If diagnosis code(s) are set, erase them all.
 
 
ASTC-ECU
Diagnosis code No.Inspection itemReference page
C1011FL wheel speed sensor signal
C1014FL wheel speed sensor performance
C101CFR wheel speed sensor signal
C101FFR wheel speed sensor performance
C1027RL wheel speed sensor signal
C102ARL wheel speed sensor performance
C1032RR wheel speed sensor signal
C1035RR wheel speed sensor performance
C1041FL wheel speed tone performance
C1042FR wheel speed tone performance
C1043RL wheel speed tone performance
C1044RR wheel speed tone performance
C1046FL wheel speed sensor phase
C1047FR wheel speed sensor phase
C1048RL wheel speed sensor phase
C1049RR wheel speed sensor phase
C1200FR wheel speed sensor (signal open circuit)
C1202FR wheel speed sensor power circuit (malfunction power circuit)

U1108Meter CAN timeout
U1109ETACS-ECU CAN timeout

note
  • *1: This diagnosis code is not set within the vehicle speed of 30 km/h or less.
  • *2: This diagnosis code is not set within the vehicle speed of 6 km/h or less.
  • *3: Vehicles for M/T
  • *4: Vehicle with rear differential lock system.
  • *5: Vehicles for 4WD
  • *6: Vehicles for A/T
  • *7: Vehicles with HDC function-M/T.
  • *8: Vehicles with FCM.
  • *9: Vehicles with HDC function.
  • *10: Vehicles with AS&G system-A/T.
 
 
STEERING WHEEL SENSOR
Diagnosis code No.Inspection itemReference page
C1550ECU failure
C1554Steering angle speed error
C1555Overflow error
C1556Detection part abnormality
C1608Malfunction of EEPROM (Data flash access error)
U0001Bus-off
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C101C, C1011, C1032, C1027, C101F, C1014, C1035, C102A
Code No. C1011: FL Wheel Speed Sensor Signal
Code No. C101C: FR Wheel Speed Sensor Signal
Code No. C1027: RL Wheel Speed Sensor Signal
Code No. C1032: RR Wheel Speed Sensor Signal
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • A toothed rotor (for wheel speed detection) generates a voltage pulse as it moves across the pickup field of each wheel speed sensor.
  • The wheel speed sensor transmit the frequency of the pulses to the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU modulates the amount of braking force individually applied to each wheel cylinder.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
ASTC-ECU monitors the signals from each wheel speed sensor while the vehicle is being driven. If any fault below is found in these sensor signals, ASTC-ECU will set the relevant diagnosis code.
  • Irregular change in the wheel speed sensor signal
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Malfunction of wheel speed sensor
  • External noise interference
  • Adhesion of foreign materials on the rotor (for wheel speed detection)
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on wiring harness and connector failures between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) and the wheel speed sensor. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1011, C101C, C1027 or C1032 set?
Go to Step 3.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1011 is set) Item No. 12: FL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C101C is set) Item No. 13: FR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1027 is set) Item No. 14: RL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1032 is set) Item No. 15: RR wheel speed sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Harness and connector check.
(1) Check the wheel speed sensor (FL, FR, RL or RR).
(2) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Check the wiring harness and connector between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and the wheel speed sensor (FL, FR, RL or RR).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the defective connector or the wiring harness. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 5. Rotor (for wheel speed detection) check.
Check the rotor (for wheel speed detection) (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the rotor (for wheel speed detection). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. Check for wheel speed sensor as a single unit.
Check the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1011, C101C, C1027 or C1032 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 8. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1011, C101C, C1027 or C1032 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C101C, C1011, C1032, C1027, C101F, C1014, C1035, C102A
Code No. C1014: FL Wheel Speed Sensor Performance
Code No. C101F: FR Wheel Speed Sensor Performance
Code No. C102A: RL Wheel Speed Sensor Performance
Code No. C1035: RR Wheel Speed Sensor Performance
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • A toothed rotor (for wheel speed sensor) generates a voltage pulse as it moves across the pickup field of each wheel speed sensor.
  • The wheel speed sensor transmit the frequency of the pulses to the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU modulates the amount of braking force individually applied to each wheel cylinder.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
ASTC-ECU monitors the signals from each wheel speed sensor while the vehicle is being driven. If any fault below is found in these sensor signals, ASTC-ECU will set the relevant diagnosis code.
  • Irregular change in the wheel speed sensor signal
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Malfunction of the wheel speed sensor
  • Excessive gap between the wheel speed sensor and the rotor (for wheel speed detection)
  • Malfunction of the wheel speed sensor installation
  • Malfunction of the wheel bearing
  • Malfunction of the front axle hub assembly
  • Malfunction of the axle shaft bearing
  • Deformation of the rotor (for wheel speed detection)
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on wiring harness and connector failures between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) and the wheel speed sensor. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1014, C101F, C102A or C1035 set?
Go to Step 3.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1014 is set) Item No. 12: FL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C101F is set) Item No. 13: FR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C102A is set) Item No. 14: RL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1035 is set) Item No. 15: RR wheel speed sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Harness and connector check.
(1) Check the wheel speed sensor (FL, FR, RL or RR).
(2) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Check the wiring harness and connector between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and the wheel speed sensor (FL, FR, RL or RR).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the defective connector or the wiring harness. Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 5. Check for wheel speed sensor installation.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the wheel speed sensor. Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 6. Check for wheel speed sensor as a single unit.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 7. Check for rotor (for wheel speed detection) installation.
<Front>
  • Refer to GROUP 26 - Front Axle Hub Assembly Removal and Installation <2WD>.
  • Refer to GROUP 26 - Driveshaft Assembly Removal and Installation <4WD>.
<Rear>
  • Refer to GROUP 27 - Axle Shaft Assembly Disassembly and Reassembly .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the rotor (for wheel speed detection). Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 8. Front axle hub assembly and wheel bearing or axle shaft bearing check.
  • Check the front axle hub assembly (Refer to GROUP 26, Front Axle Hub Assembly Removal and Installation ).
  • Check the wheel bearing (Refer to GROUP 26, On-vehicle Service ).
  • Check the axle shaft bearing (Refer to GROUP 27, On-vehicle Service ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Replace the front axle hub assembly or wheel bearing or axle shaft bearing. Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 9. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1014, C101F, C102A or C1035 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 10.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 10. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1014, C101F, C102A or C1035 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1041, C1042, C1043 or C1044
Code No. C1041: FL Wheel Speed Sensor Tone Performance
Code No. C1042: FR Wheel Speed Sensor Tone Performance
Code No. C1043: RL Wheel Speed Sensor Tone Performance
Code No. C1044: RR Wheel Speed Sensor Tone Performance
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • A toothed rotor (for wheel speed detection) generates a voltage pulse as it moves across the pickup field of each wheel speed sensor.
  • The wheel speed sensor transmit the frequency of the pulses to the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU modulates the amount of braking force individually applied to each wheel cylinder.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
ASTC-ECU monitors the signals from each wheel speed sensor while the vehicle is being driven. If any periodical drop is found in these sensor signals, ASTC-ECU will set the relevant diagnosis code.
  • External noise interference of the wheel speed sensor
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Malfunction of the wheel speed sensor
  • Malfunction of the front hub assembly
  • Teeth lack or clogging of the rotor (for wheel speed detection).
  • Adhesion of foreign materials on the rotor (for wheel speed detection)
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on wiring harness and connector failures between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) and the wheel speed sensor. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1041, C1042, C1043 or C1044 set?
Go to Step 3.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1041 is set) Item No. 12: FL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1042 is set) Item No. 13: FR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1043 is set) Item No. 14: RL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1044 is set) Item No. 15: RR wheel speed sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Rotor (for wheel speed detection) check.
Check the Rotor (for wheel speed detection) (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the rotor (for wheel speed detection). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 5. Check for wheel speed sensor as a single unit.
Check the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1041, C1042, C1043 or C1044 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1041, C1042, C1043 or C1044 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1046, C1047, C1048 or C1049
Code No. C1046: FL Wheel Speed Sensor Phase
Code No. C1047: FR Wheel Speed Sensor Phase
Code No. C1048: RL Wheel Speed Sensor Phase
Code No. C1049: RR Wheel Speed Sensor Phase
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • A toothed rotor (for wheel speed detection) generates a voltage pulse as it moves across the pickup field of each wheel speed sensor.
  • The wheel speed sensor transmit the frequency of the pulses to the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU modulates the amount of braking force individually applied to each wheel cylinder.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set if any malfunction below is found:
  • When the ABS control is operated for a long time.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Driving conditions which require the ABS control continuously.
  • Adhesion of foreign materials on the wheel speed sensor
  • Adhesion of foreign materials on the rotor (for wheel speed detection)
  • Excessive gap between the wheel speed sensor and the rotor (for wheel speed detection)
    • Malfunction of the wheel speed sensor installation
    • Malfunction of the rotor (for wheel speed detection) installation
    • Malfunction of the front axle hub assembly
    • Malfunction of the wheel bearing
    • Malfunction of the axle shaft bearing
  • Teeth lack or clogging of the rotor (for wheel speed detection)
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on wiring harness and connector failures between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) and the wheel speed sensor. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionWhen the vehicle is driven on the road which requires the ABS control frequently, this diagnosis code may be set. Therefore, prior to the diagnosis, you have to ask your customer how and when the malfunction has occurred.
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1046, C1047, C1048 or C1049 set?
Go to Step 3.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1046 is set) Item No. 12: FL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1047 is set) Item No. 13: FR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1048 is set) Item No. 14: RL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1049 is set) Item No. 15: RR wheel speed sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Harness and connector check.
(1) Check the wheel speed sensor (FL, FR, RL or RR).
(2) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Check the wiring harness and connector between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and the wheel speed sensor (FL, FR, RL or RR).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the defective connector or the wiring harness. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 5. rotor (for wheel speed detection) check.
Check the rotor (for wheel speed detection) (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the rotor (for wheel speed detection). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 6. Check for wheel speed sensor installation.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the wheel speed sensor. (Refer to .) Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 7. Check for wheel speed sensor as a single unit.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 8. Check for rotor (for wheel speed detection) installation.
<Front>
  • Refer to GROUP 26 - Front Axle Hub Assembly Removal and Installation <2WD>.
  • Refer to GROUP 26 - Driveshaft Assembly Removal and Installation <4WD>.
<Rear>
  • Refer to GROUP 27 - Axle Shaft Assembly Disassembly and Reassembly .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Replace the rotor (for wheel speed detection). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 9. Front axle hub assembly and wheel bearing or axle shaft bearing check.
  • Check the front axle hub assembly (Refer to GROUP 26, Front Axle Hub Assembly Removal and Installation ).
  • Check the wheel bearing (Refer to GROUP 26, On-vehicle Service ).
  • Check the axle shaft bearing (Refer to GROUP 27, On-vehicle Service ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Replace the front axle hub assembly or wheel bearing or axle shaft bearing. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 10. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1046, C1047, C1048 or C1049 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 11.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 11. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1046, C1047, C1048 or C1049 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1200, C1205, C1210, C1215
Code No. C1200: FR Wheel Speed Sensor (Signal Open Circuit)
Code No. C1205: FL Wheel Speed Sensor (Signal Open Circuit)
Code No. C1210: RR Wheel Speed Sensor (Signal Open Circuit)
Code No. C1215: RL Wheel Speed Sensor (Signal Open Circuit)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • A toothed rotor (for wheel speed detection) generates a voltage pulse as it moves across the pickup field of each wheel speed sensor.
  • The wheel speed sensor transmit the frequency of the pulses to the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU modulates the amount of braking force individually applied to each wheel cylinder.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
Diagnosis code No.C1200, C1205, C1210 or C1215 is set when signal is not input due to breakage of the wire of the wheel speed sensor without the output of the diagnosis code No.C1202, C1207, C1212 or C1217.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the wheel speed sensor
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on wiring harness and connector failures between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) and the wheel speed sensor. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 20 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 20 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1200, C1205, C1210 or C1215 set?
Go to Step 3.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Check that diagnosis code No. C1202, C1207, C1212 or C1217 is also set.
Is diagnosis code No. C1202, C1207, C1212 or C1217 also set?
Perform the diagnosis for diagnosis code No. C1202, C1207, C1212 or C1217 (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1200 is set) Item No. 13: FR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1205 is set) Item No. 12: FL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1210 is set) Item No. 15: RR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1215 is set) Item No. 14: RL wheel speed sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 17.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector (Short circuit to power supply).
(1) Connector check: hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and wheel speed sensor connectors
(2) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Ignition switch: "ON"
(4) Measure the voltage between the power supply terminal as well as signal terminal of each wheel speed sensor and body earth.
 
Diagnosis code No. Checking terminal
Power supply terminalSignal terminal
C1200FR+FR-
C1205FL+FL-
C1210RR+RR-
C1215RL+RL-
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1200 NG) : Go to Step 7.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1205 NG) : Go to Step 8.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1210 NG) : Go to Step 9.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1215 NG) : Go to Step 10.
 
STEP 6. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector (Short circuit to earth).
(1) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Measure the resistance between the power supply terminal as well as signal terminal of each wheel speed sensor and body earth.
 
Diagnosis code No. Checking terminal
Power supply terminalSignal terminal
C1200FR+FR-
C1205FL+FL-
C1210RR+RR-
C1215RL+RL-
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1200 NG) : Go to Step 7.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1205 NG) : Go to Step 8.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1210 NG) : Go to Step 9.
NO (Diagnosis code No. C1215 NG) : Go to Step 10.
 
STEP 7. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector FR (+) or FR (-) terminal and the front wheel speed sensor (RH) connector terminal.
Check the front wheel speed sensor (RH) circuit for short to power supply or earth.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the front wheel speed sensor (RH) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 18.
Repair the connector(s) and wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 8. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector FL (+) or FL (-) terminal and the front wheel speed sensor (LH) connector terminal.
Check the front wheel speed sensor (LH) circuit for short to power supply or earth.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the front wheel speed sensor (LH) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 18.
Repair the connector(s) and wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 9. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector RR (+) or RR (-) terminal and the rear wheel speed sensor (RH) connector terminal.
Check the rear wheel speed sensor (RH) circuit for short to power supply or earth.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the rear wheel speed sensor (RH) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 18.
Repair the connector(s) and wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 10. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector RL (+) or RL (-) terminal and the rear wheel speed sensor (LH) connector terminal.
Check the rear wheel speed sensor (LH) circuit for short to power supply or earth.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the rear wheel speed sensor (LH) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 18.
Repair the connector(s) and wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 11. Voltage and current measurement at each wheel speed sensors connector (Open circuit).
(1) Disconnect the wheel speed sensor connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Measure the voltage between the power supply terminal of each wheel speed sensors and the body earth.
(4) Measure the output current at the special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect between the wheel speed sensor-side connector and the wiring harness connector (Refer to ).
OK:
  • <Voltage> System voltage
  • <Current> 5 - 9 mA or 11 - 17 mA
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
NO [Front wheel speed sensor (RH)] : Go to Step 12.
NO [Front wheel speed sensor (LH)] : Go to Step 13.
NO [Rear wheel speed sensor (RH)] : Go to Step 14.
NO [Rear wheel speed sensor (LH)] : Go to Step 15.
 
STEP 12. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector FR (+) or FR (-) terminal and the front wheel speed sensor (RH) connector terminal.
Check the front wheel speed sensor (RH) circuit for open.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
Repair the wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 13. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector FL (+) or FL (-) terminal and the front wheel speed sensor (LH) connector terminal.
Check the front wheel speed sensor (LH) circuit for open.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
Repair the wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 14. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector RR (+) or RR (-) terminal and the rear wheel speed sensor (RH) connector terminal.
Check the rear wheel speed sensor (RH) circuit for open.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
Repair the wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 15. Check the wiring harness wires between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector RL (+) or RL (-) terminal and the rear wheel speed sensor (LH) connector terminal.
Check the rear wheel speed sensor (LH) circuit for open.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 16.
Repair the wiring harness. Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 16. Check for wheel speed sensor as a single unit.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 17.
Replace the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 18.
 
STEP 17. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 20 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 20 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1200, C1205, C1210 or C1215 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 18.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 18. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 20 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 20 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1200, C1205, C1210 or C1215 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1202, C1207, C1212, C1217
Code No. C1202: FR Wheel Speed Sensor Power Circuit (Malfunction Power Circuit)
Code No. C1207: FL Wheel Speed Sensor Power Circuit (Malfunction Power Circuit)
Code No. C1212: RR Wheel Speed Sensor Power Circuit (Malfunction Power Circuit)
Code No. C1217: RL Wheel Speed Sensor Power Circuit (Malfunction Power Circuit)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • A toothed rotor (for wheel speed detection) generates a voltage pulse as it moves across the pickup field of each wheel speed sensor.
  • The wheel speed sensor transmit the frequency of the pulses to the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU modulates the amount of braking force individually applied to each wheel cylinder.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
  • Irregular change in the wheel speed sensor voltage
  • Wheel speed sensor voltage continuously indicates low value.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the wheel speed sensor
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on wiring harness and connector failures between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) and the wheel speed sensor. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1202, C1207, C1212 or C1217 set?
Go to Step 3.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Check that diagnosis codes No. C1200, C1205, C1210, and C1215 are also set.
Are diagnosis codes No. C1200, C1205, C1210 and C1215 also set?
Follow the diagnosis procedure for diagnosis code No. C1200, C1205, C1210 or C1215 (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1202 is set) Item No. 13: FR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1207 is set) Item No. 12: FL wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1212 is set) Item No. 15: RR wheel speed sensor
  • (When diagnosis code No. C1217 is set) Item No. 14: RL wheel speed sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Voltage measurement at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector, front wheel speed sensor (RH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1202>, front wheel speed sensor (LH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1207>, rear wheel speed sensor (RH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1212>, rear wheel speed sensor (LH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1217>.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Measure the voltage between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector terminals.
Diagnosis code No. C1202 is set
  • Between FR+ terminal and body earth
Diagnosis code No. C1207 is set
  • Between FL+ terminal and body earth
Diagnosis code No. C1212 is set
  • Between RR+ terminal and body earth
Diagnosis code No. C1217 is set
  • Between RL+ terminal and body earth
OK: 1 V or less
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the defective connector or the wiring harness. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 6. Resistance measurement at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector, front wheel speed sensor (RH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1202>, front wheel speed sensor (LH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1207>, rear wheel speed sensor (RH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1212>, rear wheel speed sensor (LH) connector <diagnosis code No. C1217>.
(2) Measure the resistance between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector terminals.
Diagnosis code No. C1202 is set
  • Between FR+ terminal and body earth
Diagnosis code No. C1207 is set
  • Between FL+ terminal and body earth
Diagnosis code No. C1212 is set
  • Between RR+ terminal and body earth
Diagnosis code No. C1217 is set
  • Between RL+ terminal and body earth
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the defective connector or the wiring harness. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 7. Check for wheel speed sensor as a single unit.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 8. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1202, C1207, C1212 or C1217 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 9. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 15 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1202, C1207, C1212 or C1217 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C121D, C1361
Code No. C121D: Master Cylinder Pressure Sensor Malfunction
 
 
cautionWhen the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU incorporates the master cylinder pressure sensor, and monitors the brake fluid pressure.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITION
When the pressure sensor output signal is not within the standard value range, ASTC-ECU outputs this diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C121D set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to .) Then go to Step 2.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 2. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C121D set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1225 TYRE DIAMETER OUT OF SPECIFICATION
Code No. C1225: Wheel Speed Sensor Malfunction (Abnormality in Tyre Size)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • A toothed rotor (for wheel speed detection) generates a voltage pulse as it moves across the pickup field of each wheel speed sensor.
  • The wheel speed sensor transmit the frequency of the pulses to the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU modulates the amount of braking force individually applied to each wheel cylinder.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITION
This diagnosis code is set when the average speed of the front wheels differs from that of the rear wheel by 20 % or more after the vehicle speed exceeds 30 km/h.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Installation of different size tyres
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 30 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 30 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1225 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check the installation condition of the wheel and tyres.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Install the correct size tyres. Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 30 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 30 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1225 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 30 km/h or more.
noteThe ABS warning lamp does not turn OFF in some cases unless the vehicle runs at 30 km/h or higher.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1225 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1226: CONTROL SOLENOID VALVE (FR) PRESSURE HOLDING SYSTEM
Code No. C1226: Control Solenoid Valve (FR) Pressure Holding System
Code No. C1231: Control Solenoid Valve (FR) Decompressing System
Code No. C1236: Control Solenoid Valve (FL) Pressure Holding System
Code No. C1241: Control Solenoid Valve (FL) Pressure Reducing System
Code No. C1246: Control Solenoid Valve (RR) Pressure Holding System
Code No. C1251: Control Solenoid Valve (RR) Pressure Reducing System
Code No. C1256: Control Solenoid Valve (RL) Pressure Holding System
Code No. C1261: Control Solenoid Valve (RL) Decompressing System
Code No. C1300: Linear Valve (Secondly)
Code No. C1310: Linear Valve (Primary)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • The ASTC-ECU contains the power supply circuit for the solenoid valve. The solenoid valve is energised by the valve relay, which is incorporated in the ASTC-ECU.
  • The valve relay, which is incorporated in the ASTC-ECU, is always energising the solenoid valve unless the initial check is in progress when the ignition switch is turned on.
  • The ASTC-ECU activates the solenoid valve by turning on its driving transistor.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
These diagnosis codes will be set under the cases below.
Diagnosis code No. C1226, C1231, C1236, C1241, C1246, C1251, C1256, C1261
  • The output of the each solenoid valve does not change when the solenoid valve is ON and the solenoid valve monitor is ON
Diagnosis code No. C1300, C1310
  • The linear valve monitor is OFF when the linear valve has an open circuit.
  • The linear valve monitor is OFF when the linear valve is "ON"
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1226, C1231, C1236, C1241, C1246, C1251, C1256, C1261, C1300 or C1310 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1226, C1231, C1236, C1241, C1246, C1251, C1256, C1261, C1300 or C1310 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 4.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1226, C1231, C1236, C1241, C1246, C1251, C1256, C1261, C1300 or C1310 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1266: MOTOR SYSTEM
Code No. C1266: Motor Stuck
Code No. C1271: Motor Drive Circuit
Code No. C1273: Motor Drive Circuit Stuck Off
Code No. C1281: Motor Drive Circuit (High Voltage)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • The ASTC-ECU contains the power supply circuit (+BM terminal) for the pump motor. The pump motor is energised by the motor relay, which is incorporated in the ASTC-ECU.
  • The motor relay, which is incorporated in the ASTC-ECU, is always off unless the motor solenoid valve check is activated when the vehicle is started.
  • The ASTC-ECU activates the pump motor by turning on the ECU built-in motor relay when the ABS/ASTC is working.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
These diagnosis codes will be set under the cases below.
Diagnosis code No. C1266
  • Motor is seized.
Diagnosis code No. C1271
  • This diagnosis code will be set when the electric motor circuit fails.
Diagnosis code No. C1273
  • This diagnosis code will be set when the electric motor relay is stuck off.
Diagnosis code No. C1281
  • This diagnosis code will be set when the electric motor fail-safe relay is stuck off.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Fusible link malfunction
  • Battery failure
  • Damaged harness wires and connectors
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on connector(s) or wiring harness between the power supply circuit (+BM terminal) to the ASTC-ECU motor or earth circuit (GND1 and GND2 terminals). For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 10 km/h or more.
(4) Check that the ABS warning lamp, Brake warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp and ASTC OFF indicator lamp goes out.
(5) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1266, C1271, C1273 or C1281 set?
Go to Step 3.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check the battery.
Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery Test .
Is the auxiliary battery normal?
Go to Step 4.
Charge or replace the battery. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 4. Check the fusible link No. 4.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Remove the fusible link No. 4.
(2) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between +BM terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Replace the fusible link No.4. Then go to Step 8.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BM terminal and the fusible links, or replace the fusible links. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Measure the voltage between +BM terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BM terminal and the fusible links. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 10 km/h or more.
(4) Check that the ABS warning lamp, Brake warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp and ASTC OFF indicator lamp goes out.
(5) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1266, C1271, C1273 or C1281 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 8. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at 10 km/h or more.
(4) Check that the ABS warning lamp, Brake warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp and ASTC OFF indicator lamp goes out.
(5) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1266, C1271, C1273 or C1281 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1278: SOLENOID VALVE RELAY (OPEN CIRCUIT)
Code No. C1278: Solenoid Valve Relay (Open Circuit)
Code No. C1279: Solenoid Valve Relay (Short Circuit)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU contains the power supply circuit (+BV terminal) for the solenoid valve. The solenoid valve is energised by the valve relay, which is incorporated in the ASTC-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
These diagnosis codes will be set under the cases below.
Diagnosis code No. C1278
  • When the solenoid valve relay monitor judges that the solenoid valve relay is turned ON although it actually is turned OFF
Diagnosis code No. C1279
  • When the solenoid valve relay monitor judges that the solenoid valve relay is turned OFF although it actually is turned ON
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
The most likely causes for these diagnosis codes to set are:
  • Battery failure
  • Fusible link malfunction
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1278 or C1279 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Check the battery.
Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery Test .
Is the auxiliary battery normal?
Go to Step 4.
Charge or replace the battery. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 4. Check the fusible link No. SBF2.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Remove the fusible link No. SBF2.
(2) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between +BV terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Replace the fusible link No.SBF2. Then go to Step 9.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BV terminal and the fusible links, or replace the fusible links. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 6. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Measure the voltage between +BV terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BV terminal and the fusible links. Then go to Step 9 .
 
STEP 7. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Measure the resistance between terminals GND1 or GND2 and body earth.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
An open circuit may be present in the earth circuit. Repair the wiring harness wires between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector terminal GND1 or GND2 and body earth. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 8. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1278 or C1279 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 9. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1278 or C1279 set?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1291: REVERSE SIGNAL (SEIZURE)<M/T>
Code No. C1291: Reverse Signal (Seizure) <M/T>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The back-up lamp switch output signal is sent to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITION
When the power supply and wheel speed sensor are normal and ASTC-ECU receives the signal that the shift lever is at the reverse position while the vehicle drives at 50 km/h or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Blown fuse
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the back-up lamp switch
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on the back-up lamp switch, connector(s) or wiring harness between the back-up lamp switch to the junction block or ETACS-ECU. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnosis Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1291 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Check the back-up lamp.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(2) Check how the back-up lamp operates correctly when you move the shift lever.
OK:
  • When the shift lever is moved to reverse position: Illuminate
  • When the shift lever is moved to any position other than reverse: OFF
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
NO <comes on> : The back-lamp switch circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the back-up lamp switch and the ETACS-ECU connector back terminal or the junction block. Then go to Step 4.
NO <goes out> : The back-lamp switch circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the back-up lamp switch and the ETACS-ECU connector back terminal or the junction block. Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 4. Check the back-up lamp switch.
  • Refer to GROUP 22B - Transmission, Inspection . <2WD>
  • Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Inspection . <4WD>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
NO <2WD> : Replace the back-lamp switch (Refer to GROUP 22B - Transmission ). Then go to Step 12.
NO <4WD> : Replace the back-lamp switch (Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission ). Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 5. Measure the resistance at the back-up switch connector.
(1) Remove the back-up lamp switch connector, junction block connector and ETACS-ECU connector.
(2) Check the back-up lamp switch connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between the back-up lamp switch connector terminals and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
The back-up lamp switch circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the back-up lamp switch connector terminals and the junction block or ETACS-ECU connector. Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 6. Check the fuse No. 21.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 9.
 
STEP 7. Check the back-up lamp switch.
  • Refer to GROUP 22B - Transmission, Inspection . <2WD>
  • Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Inspection . <4WD>
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
NO <2WD> : Replace the back-lamp switch (Refer to GROUP 22B - Transmission ). Then go to Step 12.
NO <4WD> : Replace the back-lamp switch (Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission ). Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 8. Measure the resistance at the back-up switch connector.
(1) Remove the back-up lamp switch connector, junction block connector and ETACS-ECU connector.
(2) Check the back-up lamp switch connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between the back-up lamp switch connector terminals and junction block connector or ETACS-ECU connector.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
The back-up lamp switch circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the back-up lamp switch connector terminals and the junction block or ETACS-ECU connector. Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 9. Measure the resistance at the back-up switch connector.
(1) Remove the back-up lamp switch connector, junction block connector and ETACS-ECU connector.
(2) Check the back-up lamp switch connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between the back-up lamp switch connector terminals and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Replace the fuse No. 21. Then go to Step 12.
