The back-up lamp switch circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the back-up lamp switch connector terminals and the junction block or ETACS-ECU connector, or replace the fuse No. 21. Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 10. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Move the shift lever to the reverse position, and hold it for at least one second.
(4) Move the shift lever to the neutral position, and hold it for at least one second.
(5) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1291 set?
Replace the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 11.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 11. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Move the shift lever to the reverse position, and hold it for at least one second.
(4) Move the shift lever to the neutral position, and hold it for at least one second.
(5) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1291 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 12.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 12. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Move the shift lever to the reverse position, and hold it for at least one second.
(4) Move the shift lever to the neutral position, and hold it for at least one second.
(5) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1291 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1294, C1295
Code No. C1294: Abnormal Rear Differential Lock Detection Circuit
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The rear differential lock detection switch output signal is sent to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines from transfer-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITION
This diagnosis code will be set when the transfer-ECU detects a fault in the rear differential lock system.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the rear differential lock detection switch
  • Malfunction of the differential carrier assembly
  • Malfunction of the transfer-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on the rear differential lock detection switch, connector(s) or wiring harness between the rear differential lock detection switch to the junction block or transfer-ECU. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnosis Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Turn the rear differential lock switch to the "ON" position.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1294 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Diagnosis Code Chart <M/T> or GROUP 23C - Diagnosis Code Chart <A/T-ES4>, <A/T-SS4)>).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Troubleshoot the transfer-ECU diagnosis code. Then go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Turn the rear differential lock switch to the "ON" position.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1294 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Turn the rear differential lock switch to the "ON" position.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1294 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1294, C1295<4WD>
Code No. C1295: Transfer Position Error <4WD>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The transfer position switch output signal is sent to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines from transfer-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITION
This diagnosis code will be set when the transfer-ECU detects a fault in the transfer system.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the transfer
  • Malfunction of the transfer position switch
  • Malfunction of the transfer-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • Carry out diagnosis with particular emphasis on the transfer position switch, connector(s) or wiring harness between the transfer position switch to the transfer-ECU. For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnosis Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1295 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Diagnosis Code Chart <M/T> or GROUP 23C - Diagnosis Code Chart <A/T-ES4>, <A/T-SS4)>).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Troubleshoot the transfer-ECU diagnosis code. Then go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1295 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1295 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. C1296 Maifunction of 1st gear switch circuit
Code No. C1296: Malfunction of 1st gear switch circuit <Vehicles with HDC function-M/T>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU monitors whether the 1st position switch is ON or OFF.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the 1st position switch signal is assumed to be stuck in ON condition.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the 1st position switch
  • The 1st position switch improperly installed
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Move the shift lever to a position other than 1st.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1296 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 47: 1st gear SW state (Raw value)
OK:
  • ON (Transmission: 1st)
  • OFF (Transmission: Other than 1st)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for 1st position switch installation
Check the 1st position switch installation.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Install the 1st position switch correctly (Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Transmission Disassembly and Reassembly ). Then go to Step 8 .
 
STEP 5. Check of short circuit to power supply in 1st line between ASTC-ECU connector and 1st position switch connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. Check 1st position switch itself
Check 1st position switch itself (Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Transmission Inspection, 1st Position Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the 1st position switch (Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Transmission Disassembly and Reassembly ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Move the shift lever to a position other than 1st.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1296 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Move the shift lever to a position other than 1st.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1296 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. C1297 Neutral shift position switch circuit
Code No. C1297: Neutral position switch circuit <Vehicles with HDC function-M/T>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU monitors whether the neutral position switch is ON or OFF.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the neutral position switch signal is assumed to be stuck in ON condition.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the neutral position switch
  • The neutral position switch improperly installed
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Move the shift lever to a position other than neutral.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1297 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.

Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 48: Neutral SW state (Raw value)
OK:
  • ON (Transmission: Neutral)
  • OFF (Transmission: Other than neutral)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for neutral position switch installation
Check the neutral position switch installation.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Install the neutral position switch correctly (Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Transmission Disassembly and Reassembly ). Then go to Step 8 .
 
STEP 5. Check of short circuit to power supply in N line between ASTC-ECU connector and neutral position switch connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. Check Neutral position switch itself
Check neutral position switch itself (Refer to GROUP 22C - Transmission, Transmission Inspection, Neutral Position Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.

STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Move the shift lever to a position other than neutral.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1297 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Move the shift lever to a position other than neutral.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1297 set?

35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1340: ABNORMAL STOP LAMP SWITCH SIGNAL
Code No. C1340: Abnormal Stop Lamp Switch Circuit
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU monitors the ON signal and OFF signal of the stop lamp switch by receiving the signals from the ETACS-ECU via CAN bus line.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
When the vehicle has been driving at a vehicle speed of 15 km/h or more for 15 minutes or longer with the stop lamp switch turned ON.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Improper adjustment of stop lamp switch installation position
  • Malfunction of the stop lamp switch
  • Malfunction of the stop lamp relay
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the stop lamp operation
Check the stop lamp operation when the brake pedal is depressed. Check that the stop lamp and high-mount stop lamp illuminates when the brake pedal is depressed and that it goes out when the brake pedal is released.
OK:
  • When the brake pedal is released: Not illuminate
  • When the brake pedal is depressed: Illuminate
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Diagnose the rear combination lamps (Refer to GROUP 54A - Troubleshooting, Inspection Procedure4: The stop lamps do not illuminate or go out normally ). Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more for 15 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1340 set?
Go to Step 4.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 4. Check the stop lamp operation
Check the stop lamp operation when the brake pedal is depressed. Check that the stop lamp and high-mount stop lamp illuminates when the brake pedal is depressed and that it goes out when the brake pedal is released.
OK:
  • When the brake pedal is released: Not illuminate
  • When the brake pedal is depressed: Illuminate
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 17: Stop lamp switch
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11 .
Go to Step 9.
 
STEP 6. Check for stop lamp switch installation
Check the stop lamp switch installation (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pedal Check and Adjustment ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Install the stop lamp switch correctly (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pedal Check and Adjustment ). Then go to Step 12 .
 
STEP 7. Stop lamp switch continuity check
(1) Check the stop lamp switch connector.
(2) Check the stop lamp switch continuity (Refer to GROUP 35A - Brake Pedal, Inspection, Stop Lamp Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the stop lamp switch (Refer to GROUP 35A - Brake Pedal ). Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 8. M.U.T.-III other system data list
Check the data lists of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 108: Stop lamp switch
OK: ON (Depress the brake pedal), OFF (Release the brake pedal)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Replace the stop lamp relay (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Stop Lamp Relay Replacement ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 9. Voltage measurement at the ETACS-ECU connector
(1) Connector check: ETACS-ECU connector (D-415), Stop lamp switch connector (D-16) and intermediate connector (D-26)
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Measure the voltage between the stop lamp switch terminal and body earth.
OK:
  • When the brake pedal is released: 1 V or less
  • When the brake pedal is depressed: Approximately system voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
The power supply circuit may be open or short. Repair the connectors or the wiring harness wires between the ETACS-ECU connector and the stop lamp switch connector. Then go to Step 12.
 
STEP 10. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more for 15 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1340 set?
Replace the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 11.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 11. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more for 15 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1340 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 12.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 12. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Drive the vehicle at 15 km/h or more for 15 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1340 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1346 ABNORMAL STOP LAMP CIRCUIT
Code No. C1346: Abnormal Stop Lamp Circuit
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • ASTC-ECU monitors whether the stop lamp is ON or OFF.
  • The ASTC-ECU activates the stop lamp relay to illuminate the stop lamps.
  • The ASTC-ECU monitors the operating conditions of the stop lamp switch, the stop lamps and the stop lamp relay.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
  • The system cannot recognise the operating condition of the stop lamps.
  • When the stop lamp relay is OFF, the ON/OFF status of the stop lamp switch does not coincide with the actual stop lamp illumination for at least one second.
  • Although the stop lamp relay is ON, the stop lamps remain off (do not come on) for at least one second.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • The stop lamp switch improperly installed
  • Malfunction of the stop lamp switch
  • Malfunction of the stop lamp relay
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4)
cautionDo not depress the brake pedal while the actuator test is in progress.
Use the M.U.T.-III to execute actuator test item No.11 "Stop lamp test mode".
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1346 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check the stop lamp operation
Check the stop lamp operation when the brake pedal is depressed. Check that the stop lamp and high-mount stop lamp illuminates when the brake pedal is depressed and that it goes out when the brake pedal is released.
OK:
  • When the brake pedal is released: Not illuminate
  • When the brake pedal is depressed: Illuminate
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the stop lamp system (Refer to GROUP 54A - Rear combination Lamp, Troubleshooting, Symptom Procedures, Inspection Procedure 4 ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III other system data list
Check the data lists of the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 108: Stop lamp switch
OK:
  • ON (Brake pedal: Depressed)
  • OFF (Brake pedal: Released)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the ETACS system input signal procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Inspection procedure No. 10: The stop lamp switch signal not received ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III actuator test
Use the M.U.T.-III to execute the actuator test below to check the stop lamps for proper operation (Refer to ).
  • Item No.11: Stop lamp test mode
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Measure the voltage at the ASTC-ECU connector (ASTP terminal)
(1) Disconnect the connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Check the voltage between the ASTC-ECU connector ASTP terminal and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check of short to earth, and open circuit in ASTP line between ASTC-ECU connector and stop lamp relay connector. Check of short to earth, and open circuit in power supply line between fusible link (3) and stop lamp relay connector
(1) Disconnect the ASTC-ECU connector and stop lamp relay connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Measure the resistance between the ASTC-ECU connector ASTP terminal and the stop lamp relay connector terminal No.7.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less)
(3) Measure the resistance between the ASTC-ECU connector ASTP terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity (1 kΩ or more)
(4) Check the voltage between the stop lamp relay connector terminal No. 4 and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 8. Check of open circuit in earth line between the stop lamp relay connector and body earth
(1) Disconnect the stop lamp relay connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Measure the resistance between the stop lamp relay connector terminal No.6 and body earth.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Replace the stop lamp relay (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Stop Lamp Relay Replacement). Then go to Step 11.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 9. Check of open circuit in STP line between the ASTC-ECU connector and the stop lamp relay connector
(1) Disconnect the ASTC-ECU connector, and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Depress the brake pedal.
(3) Check the voltage between the ASTC-ECU connector STP terminal and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair the connector(s) or wiring harness. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 10. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4)
cautionDo not depress the brake pedal while the actuator test is in progress.
Use the M.U.T.-III to execute actuator test item No.11 "Stop lamp test mode".
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1346 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 11.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 11. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4)
cautionDo not depress the brake pedal while the actuator test is in progress.
Use the M.U.T.-III to execute actuator test item No.11 "Stop lamp test mode".
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1346 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C121D, C1361
Code No. C1361: Abnormal Master Cylinder Pressure Sensor Characteristics
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU incorporates the master cylinder pressure sensor, and monitors the brake fluid pressure.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
  • The pressure sensor output signal is not changed after the vehicle speed exceeds 7 km/h.
  • The pressure sensor output signal fluctuates only within a predetermined value while the vehicle is decelerated from 40 km/h to a standstill.
  • Pressure sensor output signal fails
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Incorrect adjustment of the stop lamp switch
  • Malfunction of the stop lamp switch
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1361 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check the stop lamp operation.
Check the stop lamp operation when the brake pedal is depressed. Check that the stop lamp and high-mount stop lamp illuminates when the brake pedal is depressed and that it goes out when the brake pedal is released.
OK:
  • When the brake pedal is released: Not illuminate
  • When the brake pedal is depressed: Illuminate
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for stop lamp switch installation.
Check the stop lamp switch installation (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pedal Check and Adjustment ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Install the stop lamp switch correctly (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pedal Check and Adjustment ). Then go to Step 8 .
 
STEP 5. Stop lamp switch continuity check.
(1) Check the stop lamp switch connector.
(2) Refer to GROUP 35A - Inspection, Stop Lamp Switch Check .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the stop lamp switch (Refer to GROUP 35A - Brake Pedal ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. Measure the voltage at ETACS-ECU connector.
(1) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Measure the voltage between ETACS-ECU BKLP terminal and body earth.
OK:
  • When the brake pedal is released: 1V or less
  • When the brake pedal is depressed: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
An open or short circuit to power supply has occurred in the wiring harness between ETACS-ECU connector and stop lamp switch connector. Repair the relevant fault. Then go to Step 8 .
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1361 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to .) Then go to Step 8.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 8. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1361 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1366, C1369, C1371, C1377, C1381, C1385, C1386, C1864
Code No. C1366: Lateral G Sensor (Output Error)
Code No. C1371: Yaw Rate Sensor Error
Code No. C1377: G and Yaw Rate Sensor Error
Code No. C1381: G Sensor (Output Error, Seizure)
Code No. C1385: Yaw Rate Sensor Active Check
Code No. C1386: G Sensor Active Check
Code No. C1864: G and Yaw Rate Sensor Power Circuit
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The G and yaw rate sensor output signal is sent to the ASTC-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
ASTC-ECU monitors the G and yaw rate sensor output signal, and when an abnormality is present in the signal from the G and yaw rate sensor, the ECU determines that the trouble occurs and sets the diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Current trouble
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
Past trouble
  • For diagnosis procedures, refer to How to treat past trouble (GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points ).
noteWhen the vehicle is driven under special conditions, such as driving on a rough road, this diagnosis code will be set.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnosis Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at the speed exceeds 10 km/h.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1366, C1371, C1377, C1381, C1385, C1386 or C1864 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list. (Refer to .)
  • Item No. 01: Longitudinal G sensor
  • Item No. 02: Lateral G sensor
  • Item No. 04: Yaw rate sensor
  • Item No. 19: Longitudinal G sensor (Raw value)
  • Item No. 20: Lateral G sensor (Raw value)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at the speed exceeds 10 km/h.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1366, C1371, C1377, C1381, C1385, C1386 or C1864 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Drive the vehicle at the speed exceeds 10 km/h.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1366, C1371, C1377, C1381, C1385, C1386 or C1864 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1366, C1369, C1371, C1377, C1381, C1385, C1386, C1864
Code No. C1369: G and Yaw Rate Sensor (Bank Run Record)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
 
 
OPERATION
The G and yaw rate sensor detects longitudinal acceleration, lateral acceleration, and yaw rate for the vehicle, and sends them to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus line.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the vehicle is driven under special conditions (laterally inclined road, etc).
noteThe ASTC indicator lamp turns OFF when the ignition switch is in the "lock" (OFF) position, or by the normal driving at the vehicle speed of 10 km/h or more.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1392, C1393
Code No. C1392: G Sensor (Zero-point not Calibrated)
Code No. C1393: Yaw Rate Sensor (Zero-point not Calibrated)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The G and yaw rate sensor output signal is sent to the ASTC-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
The ASTC-ECU receives the information of the G and yaw rate sensor calibration from the G and yaw rate sensor. When this information indicates that the calibration is not performed, the ECU sets the diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The G and yaw rate sensor calibration not executed
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnosis Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1392 or C1393 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. G and yaw rate sensor calibration.
Perform calibration of G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Calibrate the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1392 or C1393 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1392 or C1393 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1394: STEERING WHEEL SENSOR NEUTRAL POINT NOT LEARNED
Code No. C1394: Steering Wheel Sensor (Zero-point not Calibrated)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The steering wheel sensor output signal is sent to the ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
ASTC-ECU receives the information of the steering wheel sensor calibration from the steering wheel sensor. When this information indicates that the calibration is not performed, the ECU stores the diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The steering wheel sensor calibration not executed
  • Malfunction of the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor)
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnosis Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1394 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Steering wheel sensor-related diagnosis code check.
Check if the steering wheel sensor-related diagnosis code is set.
Is the steering wheel sensor-related diagnosis code set?
Carry out the appropriate troubleshooting (Refer to ). On completion, go to Step 4.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Steering wheel sensor calibration.
Perform calibration of steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
After the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced (Refer to ), calibrate the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1394 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1394 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1396: ENGINE TORQUE INPUT REFUSAL
Code No. C1396: Engine Torque Input Refusal
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C, CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU receives the engine system-related signal from the engine-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
When the torque request rejection signal from the engine-ECU indicates the rejection state, ASTC-ECU determines that the trouble occurs and sets this diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the engine-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Start the engine.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1396 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Troubleshoot the engine-ECU diagnosis code (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 7.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Engine-ECU coding data check.
Use the M.U.T.-III to check whether the engine-ECU has stored the correct coding data.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14> <4N14> or Engine-ECU <4N15> <4N15>). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 09: ASC torque intervention permitted
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14> <4N14> or Engine-ECU <4N15> <4N15>). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Start the engine.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1396 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Start the engine.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1396 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1505, C1506
Code No. C1505: Steering Wheel Sensor (Signal Seizure or Abnormal Neutral Point)
Code No. C1506: Steering Wheel Sensor (Steering Wheel Sensor Malfunction)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • Whenever diagnosis code No. C1505 is set in the ASTC-ECU, road test the vehicle before erasing the diagnosis code. Without the road test, the diagnosis code will not be set as a historic fault.
  • When the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The steering wheel sensor output signal is sent to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
When an abnormal signal is output from the steering wheel sensor, the ASTC-ECU determines that the trouble occurs and sets the diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Steering wheel sensor calibration error
  • Malfunction of the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor)
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1505 or C1506 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list.
With the front wheel facing in the straight-ahead direction, check the steering wheel sensor signal using the data list. Check that the data list deviates within ±5 degree angle from the neutral position (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 03: Steering angle
  • Item No. 21: Steering angle (Raw value)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Calibrate the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list again.
Turn the steering wheel fully to the left, and then turn it fully to the right. Then check that the value of the steering wheel sensor changes smoothly using the data list. In addition, check that the steering wheel angle on the data list almost matches the actual steering wheel angle (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 03: Steering angle
  • Item No. 21: Steering angle (Raw value)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Turn the steering wheel by 90 degree angle or more with the vehicle stationary. Then drive the vehicle straight forward for at least five seconds at 35 km/h or more.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1505 or C1506 set?
Replace the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Turn the steering wheel by 90 degree angle or more with the vehicle stationary. Then drive the vehicle straight forward for at least five seconds at 35 km/h or more.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1505 or C1506 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Turn the steering wheel by 90 degree angle or more with the vehicle stationary. Then drive the vehicle straight forward for at least five seconds at 35 km/h or more.
(4) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1505 or C1506 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1707
Code No. C1707: Implausible Coding Data
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU receives the vehicle information stored in the ETACS-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
ASTC-ECU communicates with ETACS-ECU via CAN bus lines. This diagnosis code is set when the vehicle information received from the ETACS-ECU is invalid.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • ETACS-ECU have been interchanged between two vehicles.
  • The ASTC-ECU, which was used on another vehicle, is installed on this vehicle.
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1707 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III Diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure. Then go to Step 7.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. ETACS-ECU coding data check.
Using M.U.T.-III, check if any abnormality is present to the coding data which are stored in the ETACS-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 5. Check part number of ASTC-ECU.
Check the part number of ASTC-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1707 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to .) Then go to Step 7.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1707 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. C1805 FCM/LDW/AHB malfunction
Code No. C1805: FCM/LDW/AHB malfunction <Vehicles with FCM>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
If the ASTC-ECU receives an abnormal signal from the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU with the FCM activated, it will set the diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1805 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code No. C1798 is set in the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU.
Is diagnosis code No. C1798 set in the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU?
Perform the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU diagnosis code procedure {Refer to GROUP 54A - FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU, Troubleshooting, Code No. C1798: FCM control disabled (ASC) }. Then go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1805 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1805 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. C1807 FCM/LDW/AHB TAG.deceleration sig
Code No. C1807: FCM/LDW/AHB TAG.deceleration sig <Vehicles with FCM>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
If the ASTC-ECU receives an abnormal signal from the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU with the FCM activated (automatic braking applied), it will set the diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1807 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code No. C1798 is set in the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU.
Is diagnosis code No. C1798 set in the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU?
Perform the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU diagnosis code procedure {Refer to GROUP 54A - FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU, Troubleshooting, Code No. C1798: FCM control disabled (ASC) }. Then go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1807 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. C1807 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1860: POWER SUPPLY HIGH VOLTAGE
Code No. C1860: High Voltage at ASTC-ECU Power Supply
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU is energised by the ignition switch through the multi-purpose fuse at the terminal IG1.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITION
This diagnosis code is set when the power supply voltage of the ASTC-ECU is abnormally high.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Overcurrent
  • Battery abnormality
  • Charging system failed
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnosis Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1860 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Check the battery.
Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery Test .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Charge or replace the battery (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 4. Check the charging system.
Refer to GROUP 16 - Charging System .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the charging system component(s) (Refer to GROUP 16 - Alternator ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1860 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1860 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C1861: LOW VOLTAGE AT ASTC-ECU POWER SUPPLY
Code No. C1861: Low Voltage at ASTC-ECU Power Supply
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • The ASTC-ECU is energised by the ignition switch (IG1) through J/B fuse.
  • Power supply for ABS solenoid valve is supplied to the ASTC-ECU via fusible link.
  • Power supply for ABS motor is supplied to the ASTC-ECU via fusible link.
  • The wheel speed sensors are energised via ASTC-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
The ASTC-ECU monitors the ASTC-ECU power supply voltage sent from the battery. When the voltage falls below a predetermined value, the ECU determines that the trouble occurs and sets the diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Battery failure
  • Charging system failed
  • Damaged harness wires and connectors
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus line. (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting .) On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1861 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check the battery.
Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery Test .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Charge or replace the battery (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery ). Then go to Step 13.
 
STEP 4. Check the charging system.
Refer to GROUP 16 - Charging System .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the charging system component(s) (Refer to GROUP 16 - Alternator ). Then go to Step 13.
 
STEP 5. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Connector check: the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector, the fuses (relay box) and the fusible links
(2) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between +BV terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BV terminal and the fusible links, the fuse (relay box) or the fusible links. Then go to Step 13.
 
STEP 6. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Connector check: the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and the fusible links
(2) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between +BM terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BM terminal and the fusible links. Then go to Step 13 .
 
STEP 7. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Check the connectors and the junction block.
(2) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Measure the resistance between the IG1 terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector IG1 terminal and the junction block. Then go to Step 13.
 
STEP 8. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Measure the voltage between +BV terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BV terminal and the fusible links, the fuse (relay box) or the fusible links. Then go to Step 13.
 
STEP 9. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Measure the voltage between +BM terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BM terminal and the fusible links. Then go to Step 13 .
 
STEP 10. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Measure the voltage between the IG1 terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector IG1 terminal and the junction block. Then go to Step 13.
 
STEP 11. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Measure the resistance between the GND1 terminal and body earth as well as between the GND2 terminal and body earth.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
The earth circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector GND1 terminal and the fusible links as well as between the GND2 terminal and the fusible links. Then go to Step 13.
 
STEP 12. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1861 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 13.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 13. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1861 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. C2206
Code No. C2206: Re-execution of Variant Coding
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When diagnosis code No. C2206 is set in ASTC-ECU, the diagnosis code may also be set in ETACS-ECU. When the diagnosis code is set in ETACS-ECU, carry out the diagnosis of the diagnosis code for ETACS-ECU first.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ASTC-ECU receives the vehicle information stored in the ETACS-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
The ASTC-ECU compares the last vehicle information and the information before last. If there are any differences between the two, the ECU will set this diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • ETACS-ECU have been interchanged between two vehicles.
  • The ASTC-ECU, which was used on another vehicle, is installed on this vehicle.
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C2206 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis codes.
Check if diagnosis code No. C1707 is also set simultaneously.
Is the diagnosis code No. C1707 set simultaneously?
Troubleshoot for the diagnosis code No. C1707 (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III Diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure. Then go to Step 7.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. ETACS-ECU coding data check.
Using M.U.T.-III, check if any abnormality is present to the coding data which are stored in the ETACS-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C2206 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to .) Then go to Step 7.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 7. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C2206 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. U0146 GATEWAY CAN timeout
Code No. U0146: GATEWAY CAN timeout <Vehicles with HDC function>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis code No. U0146 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
