The ASTC-ECU communicates with the gateway-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
The ASTC-ECU receives the switch input signals from the gateway-ECU via the CAN bus lines. When these signals cannot be received, the ASTC-ECU sets this diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the gateway-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0146 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the gateway-ECU. (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <Gateway-ECU (for GW-CAN-C)>, Diagnosis Function ),
Is any diagnosis code set in the gateway-ECU?
Perform the gateway-ECU troubleshooting (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <Gateway-ECU (for GW-CAN-C)>, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether an gateway "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is the diagnosis code set in other ECUs?
Replace the gateway-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54C - Gateway-ECU <for GW-CAN-C> ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0146 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0146 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U0401: ENGINE- ECU (CAN MESSAGE)
Code No. U0401: Engine ECU (CAN Message)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
Engine-related signals are sent or received to and from between ASTC-ECU and engine-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the engine-ECU malfunction has been detected.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of engine system
  • Malfunction of engine-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0401 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis codes.
Check if diagnosis code(s) other than No. U0401 is set.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure, and then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Troubleshoot the engine ECU diagnosis code (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0401 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0401 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U0402<A/T>
Code No. U0402: T/M (CAN Message) <A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
A/T-related signals are sent or received between the ASTC-ECU and the A/T-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the A/T-ECU malfunction has been detected.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the A/T-related
  • Malfunction of the A/T-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0402 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis codes.
Check if diagnosis code(s) other than No. U0402 is set.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure, and then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 23C - Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0402 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to .) Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0402 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. U0404 AS&G Parity/Toggle bit error
Code No. U0404: AS&G parity/toggle bit error <Vehicles with AS&G system-A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis code No. U0404 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
AS&G-related signals are sent or received to and from between ASTC-ECU and AS&G-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the AS&G-ECU malfunction has been detected.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of AS&G-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • External noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0404 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the AS&G-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the AS&G-ECU?
Perform the AS&G-ECU troubleshooting (Refer to GROUP 17 - Auto Stop and Go (AS&G) System, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart). Then go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0404 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0404 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U0428
Code No. U0428: SAS (CAN Message)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The steering wheel sensor outputs the steering wheel status to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when ASTC-ECU has detected the communication error in the steering wheel sensor.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor)
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0428 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis codes.
Check if diagnosis code(s) other than No. U0428 is set.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure, and then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0428 set?
Replace the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0428 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0428 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. U1004 AS&G CAN timeout
Code No. U1004: AS&G CAN timeout <Vehicles with AS&G system-A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis code No. U1004 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the AS&G-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
The ASTC-ECU receives the AS&G-related signals from the AS&G-ECU via the CAN bus lines. When these signals cannot be received, the ASTC-ECU sets this diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the AS&G-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1004 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the AS&G-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the AS&G-ECU?
Perform the AS&G-ECU troubleshooting (Refer to GROUP 17 - Auto Stop and Go (AS&G) System, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether an AS&G-ECU "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is the diagnosis code set in other ECUs?
Replace the AS&G-ECU (Refer to GROUP 17 - Auto Stop and Go (AS&G) System, AS&G-ECU). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1004 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1004 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.

caution

  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION

(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.

(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.

35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1073: BUS-OFF
Code No. U1073: Bus-off
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis code No. U1073 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when ASTC-ECU has ceased the CAN communication (bus off).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • ECU malfunction of other system
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1100: ENGINE-ECU TIMEOUT ERROR
Code No. U1100: Engine ECU CAN Timeout
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis code No. U1100 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the engine-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
The ASTC-ECU receives the engine control system-related signals from the engine-ECU via the CAN bus lines. When these signals cannot be received, the ECU sets this diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the engine-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1100 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Troubleshoot the engine-ECU diagnosis code (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether an engine-ECU "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14> <4N14> or Engine-ECU <4N15> <4N15>). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1100 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1100 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.

35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1104: STEERING WHEEL SENSOR TIMEOUT ERROR
Code No. U1104: Steering Wheel Sensor CAN Timeout
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis code No. U1104 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The steering wheel sensor outputs the steering wheel status to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
If the ASTC-ECU cannot receive any signal from the steering wheel sensor for a predetermined period, this diagnosis code will be set.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor)
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1104 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis codes.
Check if diagnosis code(s) other than No. U1104 is set.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Perform troubleshooting for the relevant diagnosis code. Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a steering wheel sensor "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Replace the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1104 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1104 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1108
Code No. U1108: Meter CAN Timeout
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis codes No. U1108 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the combination meter via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
If the ASTC-ECU cannot receive any signal from the combination meter for a predetermined period, this diagnosis code will be set.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the combination meter
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1108 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6 .
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a combination meter "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Replace the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1108 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1108 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1109: ETACS-ECU TIMEOUT ERROR
Code No. U1109: ETACS-ECU CAN Timeout
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis codes No. U1109 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the ETACS-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
If the ASTC-ECU cannot receive any signal from the ETACS-ECU for a predetermined period, this diagnosis code will be set.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6 .
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether an ETACS-ECU "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Replace the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1118<4WD>
Code No. U1118: Transfer-ECU CAN Timeout <4WD>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis codes No. U1118 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the transfer-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
If the ASTC-ECU cannot receive any signal from the transfer-ECU for a predetermined period, this diagnosis code will be set.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the transfer-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1118 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Transfer-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ) <M/T>, or (Refer to GROUP 23C - Transfer-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). <A/T>
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 22A - Transfer-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ) <M/T>, or (Refer to GROUP 23C - Transfer-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). <A/T> Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether an transfer-ECU "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Replace the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Transfer-ECU ) <M/T>, or (Refer to GROUP 23C - Transfer-ECU ).<A/T> Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1118 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1118 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1195
Code No. U1195: Coding not Completed
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis codes No. U1195 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
This diagnosis code will be set when the variant coding for the ETACS-ECU has not been implemented.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the variant coding for ETACS-ECU has not been implemented.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • The ETACS-ECU variant coding not executed
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1195 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. ETACS-ECU coding data check.
Using M.U.T.-III, check if any abnormality is present to the coding data which are stored in the ETACS-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1195 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1195 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1197
Code No. U1197: Coding Error
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis codes No. U1197 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
This diagnosis code will be set when the variant coding for the ETACS-ECU has not been implemented.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the variant coding for the ETACS-ECU is incorrect.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • The ETACS-ECU variant coding not executed
  • Malfunction of the ETACS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1197 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. ETACS-ECU coding data check.
Using M.U.T.-III, check if any abnormality is present to the coding data which are stored in the ETACS-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1197 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1197 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1211: ENG PARITY/TOGGLE BIT ERROR
Code No. U1211: ENG Parity/Toggle Bit Error
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
Engine-related signals are sent or received to and from between ASTC-ECU and engine-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the engine-ECU has detected an abnormal engine-related signal.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the engine-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1211 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Erase the diagnosis code. Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1211 set?
Replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14> <4N14> or Engine-ECU <4N15> <4N15>). Then go to Step 5.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1211 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1211 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1406: ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION ERROR
Code No. U1406: Accelerator Pedal Position Error
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
Engine-related signals are sent or received to and from between ASTC-ECU and engine-ECU via CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when the engine-ECU malfunction has been detected.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of engine system
  • Malfunction of engine-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1406 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis codes.
Check if diagnosis code(s) other than No. U1406 is set.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure, and then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Troubleshoot the engine-ECU diagnosis code (Refer to GROUP 13A - Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1406 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1406 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > CODE NO. U1419
Code No. U1419: SAS Dynamic Range Error
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The steering wheel sensor outputs the steering wheel status to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
This diagnosis code is set when ASTC-ECU has detected the dynamic range error in the steering wheel sensor.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor)
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1419 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis codes.
Check if diagnosis code(s) other than No. U1419 is set.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure, and then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1419 set?
Replace the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 5. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1419 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU). (Refer to .) Then go to Step 6.
The procedure is complete.
 
STEP 6. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U1419 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<ASTC-ECU> > Code No. U15A5 FCM/LDW/AHB CAN timeout
Code No. U15A5: FCM/LDW/AHB CAN timeout <Vehicles with FCM>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • If diagnosis code No. U15A5 is set in ASTC-ECU, always diagnose the CAN bus line. If there is any fault in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. In this case, the set diagnosis code is not highly reliable.
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The ASTC-ECU communicates with the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
The ASTC-ECU receives the FCM-related signals from the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU via the CAN bus lines. When these signals cannot be received, the ASTC-ECU sets this diagnosis code.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U15A5 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU?
Perform the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU troubleshooting (Refer to GROUP 54A - FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether a FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU "timeout" related diagnosis code is set in other ECUs (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, CAN-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is the diagnosis code set in other ECUs?
Replace the FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU, FCM/LDW/AHB-ECU ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U15A5 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U15A5 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<STEERING WHEEL SENSOR> > CODE NO. C1554, C1555, C1550, C1556, C1608
Code No. C1550: ECU Failure
Code No. C1554: Steering Angle Speed Error
Code No. C1555: Overflow Error
Code No. C1556: Detection Part Abnormality
Code No. C1608: Malfunction of EEPROM (Data Flash Access Error)
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The steering wheel sensor outputs the steering wheel status to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
Diagnosis code No. C1550
  • When the system detects an abnormal power supply voltage.
  • When the system detects an abnormal steering wheel turning speed.
  • Failure of a sensor element
Diagnosis code No. C1554
  • When the system detects an extremely high steering wheel turning speed.
Diagnosis code No. C1555
  • When the system detects an abnormal steering wheel angle.
Diagnosis code No. C1556
  • When the system detects an abnormal power supply voltage.
Diagnosis code No. C1608
  • When the system detects malfunction on read or written data.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1550, C1554, C1555, C1556 or C1608 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1550, C1554, C1555, C1556 or C1608 set?
Replace the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 4.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. C1550, C1554, C1555, C1556 or C1608 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES<STEERING WHEEL SENSOR> > CODE NO. U0001: Bus-off
Code No. U0001: Bus-off
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
The steering wheel sensor outputs the steering wheel status to ASTC-ECU via the CAN bus lines.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS CODE SET CONDITIONS
When the system detects a malfunction in the CAN-bus line.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). On completion, go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after repairing CAN bus lines.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0001 set?
Go to Step 3.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 3. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0001 set?
Replace the column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 4.
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
 
STEP 4. Check whether the diagnosis code is set again.
(1) Erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(3) Check if the diagnosis code is set.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Is diagnosis code No. U0001 set?
Return to Step 1.
The procedure is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM CHART
TROUBLE SYMPTOM CHART
caution
  • ABS may operate in the following conditions without hard braking: Low mu road surface, high-speed turn, and bumpy road surface. When asking the customers, confirm that they have/have not encountered ABS operation in corresponding conditions.
  • During ABS operation, the brake pedal is pulled forward gradually, and the noise occurs at the same time. This is because the brake line pressure varies intermittently to prevent the wheel lock, and not a system malfunction.
  • During diagnosis, a diagnosis code associated with other system may be set when the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position with connector(s) disconnected. On completion, confirm all systems for diagnosis code(s). If diagnosis code(s) are set, erase them all.
Trouble symptomInspection procedure No.Reference page
M.U.T.-III communication with ASTC system is impossible.1
ASTC indicator lamp flashes at a rate of 2Hz. <Vehicles with nono-colour liquid crystal type combination meter>2
The ASTC indicator lamp flashes and the multi-information display shows that the brake system is hot. <Vehicles with colour liquid crystal type combination meter>2
Brake warning lamp stays ON with the parking brake lever released (ABS warning lamp is OFF).3
When the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position (engine stopped), the ABS warning lamp does not illuminate.4
Brake warning lamp does not illuminate when the ignition switch is turned to "ON" position (engine stopped).5
ABS warning lamp stays ON after the engine is started.6
ASTC indicator lamp stays ON after the engine is started.7
ASTC OFF indicator lamp stays ON after the engine is started.8
The ASTC system cannot be disabled when ASTC OFF switch is pressed to turn the system OFF.9
Abnormality in brake operation.10
Abnormality in ASTC system operation.11
ASTC-ECU power supply circuit system. 12
ASTC system operates too frequently.13
ESS inoperative or improper operative.14
HSA does not work.15
HSA works on a flat road.16
The initial check sound of hydraulic unit is loud17
The HDC does not work. <Vehicles with HDC function>18
The HDC is not turned ON or OFF by operating the HDC switch. <Vehicles with HDC function>19
You cannot enter the off-road mode when you operate the drive mode-selector. <Vehicles with HDC function>20
The off-road mode is not switched among "GRAVEL", "MUD/SNOW", "SAND" and "ROCK" by operating the off-road mode selector. <Vehicles with HDC function>21
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > M.U.T.-III communication with ASTC system is impossible.
Inspection Procedure 1: M.U.T.-III Communication with ASTC system is Impossible.
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
When M.U.T.-III cannot communicate with the ASTC system, the CAN bus lines, ASTC-ECU power supply circuit system, earth, or ASTC-ECU may be faulty.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Wrong routing of M.U.T.-III harness
  • Abnormality in battery or alternator
  • Abnormality in power supply voltage to ASTC-ECU
  • ECU malfunction of other system
 
 
M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Check the power supply circuit, and repair if necessary (Refer to ).
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > ASTC INDICATOR LAMP FLASHES AT A RATE OF 2HZ<VEHICLES WITH MONO-COLOUR LIQUID CRYSTAL DISPLAY T>
Inspection Procedure 2: ASTC Indicator Lamp Flashes at a Rate of 2Hz <Vehicles with Mono-colour Liquid Crystal Type Combination Meter>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
When the ASTC indicator lamp flashes at a rate of 2 Hz, the ASTC is prohibited.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This operation is performed for the following reasons and is not a malfunction.
  • ASTC-ECU calculates the estimated temperature of the brake pad. In general, as the brake pad temperature increases, the coefficient of friction for the brake pad becomes smaller, resulting in the reduced braking force. When the estimated temperature of the brake pad reaches the specified value or more, ASTC-ECU flashes the ASTC indicator lamp at a rate of 2 Hz to warn the driver that the brake controllability by ASTC is decreased by the reduced braking force. Consequently, ASTC-ECU prohibits the ASTC control until it determines that the estimated temperature of the brake pad is normal.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Overheat of brake pad
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > The ASTC indicator lamp flashes and the multi-information display shows that the brake system is hot<VEHICLES WITH COLOUR LIQUID CRYSTAL DISPLAY TYPE C>
Inspection Procedure 2: The ASTC Indicator Lamp Flashes and the Multi-information Display Shows That the Brake System is Hot. <Vehicles with Colour Liquid Crystal Type Combination Meter>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
If the ASTC indicator lamp flashes and the multi-information display shows that the brake system is hot, the ASTC will be disabled.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This operation is performed for the following reasons and is not a malfunction.
  • ASTC-ECU calculates the estimated temperature of the brake pad. In general, as the brake pad temperature increases, the coefficient of friction for the brake pad becomes smaller, resulting in the reduced braking force. When the estimated temperature of the brake pad reaches the specified value or more, ASTC-ECU flashes the ASTC indicator lamp at a rate of 2 Hz to warn the driver that the brake controllability by ASTC is decreased by the reduced braking force. Consequently, ASTC-ECU prohibits the ASTC control until it determines that the estimated temperature of the brake pad is normal.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
  • Overheat of brake pad
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > WHEN THE IGNITION SWITCH IS TURNED TO THE "ON" POSITION (ENGINE STOPPED), THE BRAKE WARNING LAMP DOES NOT ILLUMINATE.
Inspection Procedure 3: Brake Warning Lamp Stays ON with the Parking Brake Lever Released (ABS Warning Lamp is OFF).
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • When the parking brake switch is turned ON, the combination meter (BRK terminal) is earthed, and the brake warning lamp illuminates.
  • When reduction of the brake fluid amount is detected, the brake fluid level switch is turned from OFF to ON. meter-ECU monitors the brake fluid level switch, and instructs the combination meter via the CAN bus line to illuminate the brake warning lamp.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The brake pad thickness is at the limit value or less.
  • The brake fluid amount is at the "MIN" level or lower.
  • Poor adjustment of the parking brake lever
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Parking brake switch malfunction
  • Malfunction of brake fluid level switch
  • Combination meter malfunction
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ).
 
STEP 2. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the combination meter and ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ) and (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ) and (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Brake fluid level check.
Check that the brake fluid is filled up to the "MIN" level or higher.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Brake pad check.
Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pad Check .
Is the check result normal?
Fill the brake fluid up to the "MAX" level. Then go to Step 11.
Replace the brake pad (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pad Replacement ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 5. Brake fluid level switch check.
Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Fluid Level Switch Check .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the brake fluid level switch (Refer to GROUP 35A - Master Cylinder Assembly and Brake Booster Assembly <L.H. drive vehicles> or <R.H. drive vehicles>). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 6. Measure the voltage at the brake fluid level switch connector.
(1) Check the connector.
(2) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(4) Measure the voltage between the combination meter connector LVL terminal and body earth.
OK: Approximately system voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires and connectors. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 7. Parking brake lever stroke check.
Refer to GROUP 36 - On-vehicle Service .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Adjust the parking brake lever stroke (Refer to GROUP 36 - On-vehicle Service ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 8. Parking brake switch check.
Refer to GROUP 36 - On-vehicle Service .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Replace the parking brake switch (Refer to GROUP 36 - Parking Brake Lever ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 9. Measure the voltage at the parking brake switch connector.
(1) Check the connector.
(2) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
(4) Measure the voltage between the combination meter connector BRK terminal and body earth.
OK: Approximately system voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires and connectors. Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 10. Retest the system.
Does the brake warning lamp turn ON and OFF normally according to the parking brake lever operation?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the combination meter assembly (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Retest the system.
Does the brake warning lamp turn ON and OFF normally according to the parking brake lever operation?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > WHEN THE IGNITION SWITCH IS TURNED TO THE "ON" POSITION (ENGINE STOPPED), THE ABS WARNING LAMP DOES NOT ILLUMINATE.
Inspection Procedure 4: When the Ignition Switch is Turned to the "ON" Position (Engine Stopped), the ABS Warning Lamp does not Illuminate.
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • ASTC-ECU sends the illumination request signal of the ABS warning lamp to the combination meter via the CAN communication.
  • ASTC-ECU illuminates ABS warning lamp for approximately 3 seconds for valve check with the ignition switch turned to the "ON" position.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This may be caused by faults in the CAN bus line, ETACS-ECU, combination meter or ASTC-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • The ETACS-ECU coding data is abnormal.
  • Malfunction of ETACS-ECU
  • Malfunction of the combination meter
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. ETACS-ECU coding data check.
Using M.U.T.-III, check if any abnormality is present to the coding data which are stored in the ETACS-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 7.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Retest the system.
Does the ABS warning lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Retest the system.
Does the ABS warning lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > BRAKE WARNING LAMP DOES NOT ILLUMINATE WHEN THE IGNITION SWITCH IS TURNED TO ON POSITION (ENGINE STOPPED).
Inspection Procedure 5: Brake Warning Lamp does not Illuminate when the Ignition Switch is Turned to "ON" Position (Engine Stopped).
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • ASTC-ECU sends the illumination request signal of the break warning lamp to the combination meter via the CAN communication.
  • ASTC-ECU illuminates brake warning lamp for approximately 3 seconds for bulb check with the ignition switch turned to the "ON" position.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This may be caused by faults in the CAN bus line, combination meter or ASTC-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the combination meter
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnostics.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 3
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III Special Function for other system.
Perform the following special function by the combination meter system, and check if the ABS warning lamp illuminates (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter ).
  • Item No. 6: Indicator (AUTO)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4
