Replace the combination meter.
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6 .
Go to Step 5
 
STEP 5. Retest the system.
Does the brake warning lamp turn ON and OFF
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Retest the system.
Does the brake warning lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > ABS WARNING LAMP STAYS ON AFTER THE ENGINE IS STARTED.
Inspection Procedure 6: ABS Warning Lamp Stays ON After the Engine is Started.
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • ASTC-ECU sends the illumination request signal of the ABS warning lamp to the combination meter via CAN communication.
  • ASTC-ECU illuminates the ABS warning lamp for approximately 3 seconds for valve check with the ignition switch turned to the "ON" position.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This may be caused by faults in the CAN bus line, combination meter or ASTC-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the combination meter
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Control stop due to the low voltage
    noteDue to the abnormality in the supply voltage, the diagnosis code may not be set even when the ABS warning lamp is illuminated.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 3
 
STEP 3. Check the ASTC-ECU power supply circuit system.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4
Diagnose the power supply circuit of the ASTC-ECU (Refer to ).
 
STEP 4. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5
 
STEP 5. Retest the system.
Does the ABS warning lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Retest the system.
Does the ABS warning lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > THE ASTC INDICATOR LAMP REMAINS ILLUMINATED AFTER THE ENGINE IS STARTED.
Inspection Procedure 7: ASTC Indicator Lamp Stays ON After the Engine is Started.
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • ASTC-ECU sends the illumination request signal of the ASTC indicator lamp to the combination meter via the CAN communication.
  • ASTC-ECU illuminates ASTC indicator lamp for approximately 3 seconds for valve check with the ignition switch turned to the "ON" position.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This may be caused by faults in the CAN bus line, combination meter or ASTC-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the combination meter
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 5.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Retest the system.
Does the ASTC indicator lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Retest the system.
Does the ASTC indicator lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > THE ASTC OFF INDICATOR LAMP REMAINS ILLUMINATED AFTER THE ENGINE IS STARTED.
Inspection Procedure 8: ASTC OFF Indicator Lamp Stays ON After the Engine is Started.
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • ASTC-ECU sends the illumination request signal of the ASTC OFF indicator lamp to the combination meter via the CAN communication.
  • ASTC-ECU illuminates ASTC OFF indicator lamp for approximately 3 seconds for valve check with the ignition switch turned to the "ON" position.
  • When the ASTC OFF switch is pressed for 3 seconds or more, the ASTC system will be deactivated.
  • When the ASTC OFF switch is pressed for 15 seconds or more, the ASTC system will be held in ON state and it cannot be deactivated until the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position the next time.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This may be caused by faults in the CAN bus line, combination meter or ASTC-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Malfunction of the combination meter
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Measure the resistance between SWON terminal and body earth.
OK:
  • When the ASC OFF switch is pressed: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less)
  • When the ASC OFF switch is not pressed: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check the ASTC OFF switch.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the ASTC OFF switch (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 5. Measure the resistance at the ASTC OFF switch connector.
(1) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Check the ASTC OFF switch connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector SWON terminal and ASTC OFF switch and resistance between ASTC OFF switch and body earth.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
The circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector SWON terminal and ASTC OFF switch and resistance between ASTC OFF switch and body earth. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check whether a diagnosis code is set in the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Retest the system.
Does the ASTC OFF indicator lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Retest the system.
Does the ASTC OFF indicator lamp turn ON and OFF normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > WHEN THE TCL SWITCH IS PUSHED, TCL SYSTEM CANNOT BE DISABLED.
Inspection Procedure 9: The ASTC System cannot be Disabled when ASTC OFF Switch is Pressed to Turn the System OFF.
 
 
caution
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • The hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector terminal (SWON) is earthed by pressing the ASTC OFF switch.
  • When the ASTC OFF switch remains pressed for 3 seconds or more, the ASC control and the ATC engine control will be deactivated.
  • When the ASTC OFF switch remains pressed for 15 seconds or more, the ASC and the ATC systems will be activated.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
This phenomenon may be caused by the open circuit in ASTC OFF switch circuit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of the ASTC OFF switch
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(3) Measure the resistance between SWON terminal and body earth.
OK:
  • When the ASTC OFF switch is pressed: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less)
  • When the ASTC OFF switch is not pressed: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the ASTC OFF switch.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the ASTC OFF switch (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 3. Measure the resistance at the ASTC OFF switch connector.
(1) Check the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Check the ASTC OFF switch connector.
(3) Disconnect the connector and measure at the wiring harness side.
(4) Measure the resistance between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector SWON terminal and ASTC OFF switch and resistance between ASTC OFF switch and body earth.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
The circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector SWON terminal and ASTC OFF switch and resistance between ASTC OFF switch and body earth. Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Retest the system.
Does the ASTC OFF switch turn ON and OFF normally?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Retest the system.
Does the ASTC OFF switch turn ON and OFF normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > ABNORMALITY IN BRAKE OPERATION
Inspection Procedure 10: Abnormality in Brake Operation.
 
 
caution
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Although the cause of the trouble cannot be clearly resolved since it depends on the running status and road surface condition, the malfunction of the hydraulic circuit may occur if any diagnosis code is not detected.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Malfunction of hydraulic circuit
  • Malfunction of brake assembly
  • Malfunction of Brake booster
  • Malfunction of master cylinder assembly
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) check.
Check that the brake tube is installed to the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) correctly (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Connect the brake tubes correctly, and repair or replace the external brake lines of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
 
STEP 3. Brake operation check.
Perform the following checks.
  • Brake pedal check (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pedal Check ).
  • Brake booster check (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Booster Operation Check ).
  • Check valve check (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Check Valve Operation Check ).
Can any fault be found with the brake operation?
Check the brake-related parts, and repair if necessary. Then, go to Step 4.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Hydraulic unit check.
Perform the following actuator tests. (Refer to .)
  • Item No. 01: FL wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 02: FR wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 03: RL wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 04: RR wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 05: FL wheel TCL drive
  • Item No. 06: FR wheel TCL drive
  • Item No. 07: RL wheel TCL drive
  • Item No. 08: RR wheel TCL drive
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ).
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > ABNORMAL ACTIVE STABILITY CONTROL SYSTEM OPERATION
Inspection Procedure 11: Abnormality in ASTC System Operation.
 
 
caution
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
In case of this trouble symptom, the ASTC system operation may be disabled. Diagnosis code may be set by the ASTC system using M.U.T.-III.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Low battery voltage
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • Engine coding data problem
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Different ETACS-ECU, abnormal variant coding information
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Engine-ECU coding data check.
Using M.U.T.-III, check if any abnormality is present to the coding data below which are stored in the engine-ECU.
A.S.C.
  • OK: Available
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the engine-ECU (Refer to GROUP 13A - Engine-ECU <4N14> <4N14> or Engine-ECU <4N15> <4N15>). Then go to Step 4.
 
STEP 3. Hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) check.
Check that the brake tube is installed to the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) correctly (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 4.
Connect the brake tubes correctly, and repair or replace the external brake lines of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
 
STEP 4. Retest the system.
Does ASTC system operation normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Check the brake system related components other than the ASTC system.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > TCL/ACTIVE STABILITY CONTROL SYSTEM-ECU POWER SUPPLY CIRCUIT SYSTEM
Inspection Procedure 12: ASTC-ECU Power Supply Circuit System.
 
 
caution
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
  • The ASTC-ECU contains the power supply circuit (+BV terminal) for the solenoid valve. The solenoid valve is energized by the valve relay, which is incorporated in the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU contains the power supply circuit (+BM terminal) for the pump motor. The pump motor is energized by the motor relay, which is incorporated in the ASTC-ECU.
  • The ASTC-ECU contains the power supply circuit (IG1 terminal) for itself. When the ignition switch (IG1) is turned ON, the voltage is applied to the relay incorporated in the ETACS-ECU to turn ON the relay, and the power is supplied from the fusible link through the multi-purpose fuse.
  • When malfunction occurs in ASTC-ECU power supply, the communication with M.U.T.-III becomes unavailable.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Battery failure
  • Improper tightening of battery terminal
  • Charging system failed
  • Damaged harness wires and connectors
  • Fuse and fusible link malfunction
  • Improper tightening of earth bolt
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the batter.
Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery Test .
Is the battery in good condition?
Go to Step 3.
Charge or replace the battery. Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the charging system.
Refer to GROUP 16 - Charging System .
Is the charging system in good condition?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the charging system component(s).
 
STEP 3. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Connector check: the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU), the fuses (relay box) and the fusible links.
(2) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Measure the resistance between +BV terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BV terminal and the fuse (relay box), the fuses (relay box) or the fusible links. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 4. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Connector check: the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and the fusible links
(2) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and remove the fusible links.
(3) Measure the resistance between +BM terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BM terminal and the fusible links, or the fusible links. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 5. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Connector check: the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector and the junction block
(2) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(3) Measure the resistance between the IG1 terminal and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
The power supply circuit may be short. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector IG1 terminal and the junction block. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 6. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Measure the voltage between +BV terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BV terminal and the fuse (relay box) or the fuses (relay box). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 7. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Measure the voltage between +BM terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector +BM terminal and the fusible links, or the fusible links. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 8. Measure the voltage at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Ignition switch: "ON"
(3) Measure the voltage between the IG1 terminal and body earth.
OK: Battery voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
The power supply circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector IG1 terminal and the junction block. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 9. Measure the resistance at the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(1) Disconnect the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector.
(2) Measure the resistance between the GND1 terminal and body earth as well as between the GND2 terminal and body earth.
OK: Continuity exists (2 Ω or less).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
The earth circuit may be open. Repair the wiring harness wires or connectors between the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) connector GND1 terminal and the fusible links as well as between the GND2 terminal and the fusible links. Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 10. Retest the system.
Make sure that the M.U.T.-III cable is properly connected and the V.C.I. switch is ON.
Is the communication with M.U.T.-III possible?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Retest the system.
Make sure that the M.U.T.-III cable is properly connected and the V.C.I. switch is ON.
Is the communication with M.U.T.-III possible?
Return to Step 1.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > ABS/STABILITY CONTROL/TCL OPERATES TOO FREQUENTLY.
Inspection Procedure 13: ASTC System Operates too Frequently.
 
 
caution
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
  • Although the cause of the trouble cannot be clearly resolved since it depends on the running status and road surface condition, the malfunction of the hydraulic circuit may occur if any diagnosis code is not detected.
  • If wheels and tyres other than the ones with genuine specified size are mounted, the ASTC system may be activated prematurely.
  • If a non-genuine braking device or non-genuine impact reduction device is mounted, the ASTC system may be activated prematurely.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Mounting of wheels and tyres other than with genuine specified size
  • Tyre pressure abnormality
  • Tyre wear and deterioration
  • Mounting of non-genuine braking device or impact reduction device
  • Wheel alignment abnormality
  • Malfunction of the brake related parts
  • Malfunction of the wheel speed sensor
  • Malfunction of the steering wheel sensor
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Malfunction of hydraulic circuit
  • External radio wave noise interference
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the wheels and the tyres.
Carry out the following check.
  • Size check of wheels and tyres
  • Tyre wear and deterioration statuses
  • Check the tyre pressure.
    noteFor the tyre pressure, refer to the tyre pressure label attached to the lower section of driver's side door striker.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct the wheels and tyres in good condition. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Carry out the diagnosis for the diagnosis code (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check of brake system related components other than hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
At the same time with the following checks, also check that no parts other than the genuine parts are mounted.
  • Brake pad check (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Pad Check ).
  • Brake disc runout check (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Brake Disc Check ).
  • Brake drag force check (Refer to GROUP 35A - Front Disc Brake Assembly <1-Piston> <Front (1-Piston)> or Front Disc Brake Assembly <2-Piston> <Front (2-Piston)>, and GROUP 35A - Rear Drum Brake Assembly <rear>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the part(s) having damage or other problems. Then go to Step 9 .
 
STEP 4. Wheel alignment check.
At the same time with the following checks, also check that no parts other than the genuine parts are mounted.
  • Front wheel alignment check (Refer to GROUP 33 - On-vehicle Service, Front Wheel Alignment Check and Adjustment ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the part(s) having damage or other problems. Then go to Step 9 .
 
STEP 5. Wheel speed sensor check.
Check that no non-genuine electronic device or no wiring harness of the device other than genuine electronic device is mounted near the wheel speed sensor (at wheel speed detection section and wiring harness section) (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Remove the non-genuine electronic device or the wiring harness of non-genuine electronic device. Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list.
Check the following data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 04: Yaw rate sensor
  • Item No. 12: FL wheel speed sensor
  • Item No. 13: FR wheel speed sensor
  • Item No. 14: RL wheel speed sensor
  • Item No. 15: RR wheel speed sensor
  • Item No. 20: Lateral G sensor (Raw value)
  • Item No. 21: Steering angle (Raw value)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
NO (Abnormality with items No. 12 to 15) : Check the installation status of corresponding wheel speed sensor (Refer to ).
NO (Abnormality with item No. 04 or 20) : Go to Step 7.
NO (Abnormality with item No. 21) : Check the installation status of steering wheel sensor (Refer to ).
 
STEP 7. Hydraulic unit check.
Carry out the following actuator tests, and check if they work normally (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 01: FL wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 02: FR wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 03: RL wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 04: RR wheel ABS drive
  • Item No. 05: FL wheel TCL drive
  • Item No. 06: FR wheel TCL drive
  • Item No. 07: RL wheel TCL drive
  • Item No. 08: RR wheel TCL drive
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 8. Retest the system.
Does ASTC system operation normally?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 9. Retest the system.
Does ASTC system operation normally?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > ESS INOPERATIVE OR IMPROPER OPERATIVE
Inspection Procedure 14: ESS Inoperative or Improper Operative.
 
 
caution
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Because the ASTC system has set the diagnosis code, the ESS may be disabled.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Low battery voltage
  • The CAN bus line is defective.
  • The ASTC-ECU, which was used on another vehicle, is installed on this vehicle.
  • The ETACS-ECU, which was used on another vehicle, is installed on this vehicle.
  • Wrong coding which the ETACS-ECU has stored.
  • ETACS-ECU malfunction
  • Damaged harness wires and connectors
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the part number of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
Check the part number of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check part number of ETACS-ECU.
Check the part number of ETACS-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use the M.U.T.-III to check whether the ASTC system (Refer to ) and the ETACS system set a diagnosis code (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Function ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Diagnose the system according to the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to ) <ASTC system> or (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Diagnosis Code Chart ) <ETACS system>, and then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III actuator test.
Perform the actuator test below to function-check the ESS (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: ESS test mode
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. ETACS-ECU coding data check.
Using M.U.T.-III, check if any abnormality is present in the coding data below which is stored in the ETACS-ECU.
ESS
  • OK: Available
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 6. Check the ASTC-ECU power supply circuit.
Refer to .
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Diagnose the power supply circuit to the ASTC-ECU (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III actuator test.
Perform the actuator test below to function-check the ESS (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: ESS test mode
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Replace ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS-ECU ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 8. M.U.T.-III actuator test.
Perform the actuator test below to function-check the ESS (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: ESS test mode
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 9.
 
STEP 9. M.U.T.-III actuator test.
Perform the actuator test below to function-check the ESS (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: ESS test mode
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > HSA DOES NOT WORK.
Inspection Procedure 15: HSA does not Work.
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
  • The slope gradient may be low.
  • The vehicle is not completely stationary.
  • A failure may have occurred in the calibration of the G and yaw rate sensor.
  • The parking brake switch may be seized, which causes the HSA to fail to start the operation.
  • A problem (noise interference) may have occurred in the CAN bus line, resulting in an improper communication with ASTC-ECU or each ECU.
note
  • The HSA does not work even when the wheel speed sensor output pulse (vehicle moved) while the vehicle is parked.
  • The HSA is affected by the loading conditions and vehicle posture at the occurrence of phenomenon. When checking the HSA operation in actual driving, carry out the check on the vehicle with 1 person on the driver's seat.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Calibration failure of the G and yaw rate sensor
  • Seizure of the parking brake switch
  • Malfunction of wheel speed sensor
  • Malfunction of A/T-ECU
  • Malfunction of hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
  • Wiring harness or connector failure of CAN bus line
  • Damaged wiring harness and connectors
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. HSA function check.
Check if the HSA works with 1 person on the driver's seat.
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the parking brake.
Check whether the parking brake warning lamp remains ON with the parking brake lever not pulled up.
Does the parking brake warning lamp remain ON?
Proceed to the symptom procedure "Brake warning lamp stays ON with the parking brake lever released (ABS warning lamp is OFF)" (Refer to ). Then go to Step 10.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting ). Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code for the ASTC system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to ).
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list.
Evaluate the data list below.
  • Pull the parking brake lever.
 
Item No.Item nameNormal conditions
18Parking brake switchON
  • Release the parking brake lever.
 
Item No.Item nameNormal conditions
18Parking brake switchfrom ON to OFF
  • Move the selector lever to "R", "D", "N" and "P".
 
Item No.Item nameNormal conditions
10Target gear
  • R
    • Selector lever position: "R"
  • D
    • Selector lever position: "D"
  • P
    • Selector lever position: "P"
  • N
    • Selector lever position: "N"
11Actual gear
Is the check result normal?
YES : Go to Step 6.
NO <item No. 18> : Proceed to the symptom procedure "Brake warning lamp stays ON with the parking brake lever released (ABS warning lamp is OFF)" (Refer to ). Then go to Step 10 .
NO <item No. 10, 11> : Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list.
Evaluate the data list below with 1 person on the driver's seat and the vehicle otherwise unloaded (unladen weight) on a smooth flat surface (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 19: Longitudinal G sensor (Raw value)
  • Item No. 20: Lateral G sensor (Raw value)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Calibrate the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ). Then go to Step 10.
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III data list.
Evaluate the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 22: M/C pressure (Raw value)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 10.
 
STEP 8. Use M.U.T.-III to confirm a diagnosis code of other systems.
Check if the diagnosis code is set in the A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Is the diagnosis code set?
Follow the relevant diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 23C - Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 10.
Go to Step 9.
 
STEP 9. Retest the system.
Check if the HSA works with 1 person on the driver's seat.
Is the check result normal?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ).
 
STEP 10. Retest the system.
Check if the HSA works with 1 person on the driver's seat.
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 2.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > HSA WORKS ON A FLAT ROAD.
Inspection Procedure 16: HSA Works on a Flat Road.
 
 
caution
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
  • A failure may have occurred in the calibration of the G & yaw rate sensor.
  • Some drivers mistake a brake dragging for HSA operation.
  • If the suspension is modified, the vehicle posture changes, and the ASTC-ECU judges that the vehicle is on a steep slope and may activate HSA.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The G and yaw rate sensor improperly calibrated
  • Brake drag
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. HSA function check.
Check if the HSA works with 1 person on the driver's seat.
Does the HSA work on a flat road?
Go to Step 2.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list.
Evaluate the data list below with 1 person on the driver's seat and the vehicle otherwise unloaded (unladen weight) on a smooth flat surface (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 19: Longitudinal G sensor (Raw value)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check the brake system for brake drag.
Check the brake system for brake drag.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the brake drag. Then go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Retest the system.
Check if the HSA works with 1 person on the driver's seat.
Does the HSA work on a flat road?
Return to Step 2.
This diagnosis is complete.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > THE INITIAL CHECK SOUND OF HYDRAULIC UNIT LOUD
Inspection Procedure 17: The Initial Check Sound of Hydraulic Unit is Loud.
 
 
cautionWhen installing brake tube, match the axial centre of flare nut and brake tube with the centre of hole at the hydraulic unit side, and check that the fluid does not leak.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The operation sound may be decreased by reducing the load at the rubber mount portion of the brake tube and hydraulic unit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Improper installation of the hydraulic unit
  • Improper installation of the brake tube
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
Driving Check.
(1) Turn the ignition switch from the "LOCK" (OFF) position to the "ON" position.
(2) Drive the vehicle until the vehicle speed reaches 10 km/h, check the operating sound volume and compare it with that of the same model.
OK: The operating sound is the same volume or less by comparing with that of the same model.
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Carry out adjustment for hydraulic unit installation (Refer to ).
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > Hill descent control does not work.<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION>
Inspection Procedure 18: The HDC Does not Work. <Vehicles with HDC Function>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The HDC is not activated under any of the following conditions:
  • The HDC is turned OFF
  • The vehicle is stationary or the vehicle speed is 20 km/h or more
  • On a gentle gradient
  • Rear differential lock system: Lock
  • Gearshift lever: Forward gear except the 1st position
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Retest the system
Is the HDC activated when you drive downhill on a non-gentle gradient at 20 km/h or less with the HDC turned ON?
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code .
Is any diagnosis code set?
Perform the troubleshooting for the diagnosis code (Refer to Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 7.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Operate the HDC switch to check the system
Is the HDC turned ON when you operate the HDC switch while all of the following conditions are satisfied?
  • Stop the vehicle.
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5. <M/T>
Go to Step 6. <A/T>
Perform the symptom procedure (Refer to Inspection Procedure 19: The HDC is not turned ON or OFF by operating the HDC switch ). Then go to Step 7 .
 
STEP 5. Check the HDC function <M/T>
Is the HDC activated when the gearshift lever is moved to the 1st position?
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
1st position switch circuit inspection (Refer to Diagnosis Code Procedures, Code No. C1296: Malfunction of 1st gear switch circuit ). Then go to Step 7 .
 
STEP 6. Retest the system
Is the HDC activated when you drive downhill on a non-gentle gradient at 20 km/h or less with the HDC turned ON?
Is the check result normal?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 7 .
 
STEP 7. Retest the system
Is the HDC activated when you drive downhill on a non-gentle gradient at 20 km/h or less with the HDC turned ON?
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > Hill descent control is activated or deactivated by operating the hill descent control switch.<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION>
Inspection Procedure 19: The HDC is Not Turned ON or OFF by Operating the HDC Switch. <Vehicles with HDC Function>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ON and OFF signals of the HDC switch are sent to ASTC-ECU from the gateway-ECU via CAN bus line.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
  • The HDC switch input circuit fails.
  • The HDC cannot be turned ON under any of the conditions: A warning notice is displayed on the multi-information display in the combination meter.
    1. Vehicle speed exceeds 20 km/h.
    2. Rear differential lock system: Lock
    3. The brake pads are hot.
    4. The ASTC-ECU detects a malfunction.
    5. The FCM is activated
  • When the HDC switch is pressed for 15 seconds or more, or the HDC switch is being pressed for long time in a certain condition such as something is put onto the HDC switch.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • When the ASTC-ECU stores the condition in which the HDC switch is being pressed for long time
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of HDC switch
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Restart the HDC
ASTC-ECU stores the condition, in which the HDC switch is being pressed for long time, when the HDC switch is being pressed for 15 seconds or more, or the HDC switch is being pressed for long time in a certain condition such as something is put onto the HDC switch. If you operate the switch in the condition above, HDC can not be turned ON/OFF, so perform the following procedures to clear the HDC switch condition, in which the HDC switch is being pressed for long time, stored in the ASTC-ECU.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Restart the engine.
(3) Is the HDC turned ON when you operate the HDC switch while all of the following conditions are satisfied?
  • Stop the vehicle.
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the HDC restarted by operating the HDC switch?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Retest the system
Is the HDC turned ON when you operate the HDC switch while all of the following conditions are satisfied?
  • Stop the vehicle.
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Perform the troubleshooting for the diagnosis code (Refer to Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 8.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check HDC switch itself
Check HDC switch itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the HDC switch (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 36: HDC switch
OK:
  • ON (When the HDC switch is pushed)
  • OFF (When the HDC switch is not pushed)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Perform the gateway-ECU input signal procedure {Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <Gateway (for GW-CAN-C)>, Input Signal Procedures, Inspection Procedure 2: The HDC switch signal is not received }. Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 7. Retest the system
Is the hill descent control turned on when you operate the hill descent control switch while all of the following conditions are satisfied?
  • Stop the vehicle.
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the check result normal?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8 .
 
STEP 8. Retest the system
Is the hill descent control turned on when you operate the hill descent control switch while all of the following conditions are satisfied?
  • Stop the vehicle.
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > Off-road mode does not work.<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION>
Inspection Procedure 20: You Cannot Enter the Off-road Mode When You Operate the Drive Mode-selector. <Vehicles with HDC Function>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
When you set the drive mode-selector to "4HLc" or "4LLc", the ASTC-ECU will enter the off-road mode, and "GRAVEL" will appear on the multi-information display in the combination meter.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of the drive mode-selector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Retest the system
When you set the drive mode-selector to "4HLc" or "4LLc", "GRAVEL" should appear on the multi-information display in the combination meter.
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code .
Is any diagnosis code set?
Perform the troubleshooting for the diagnosis code (Refer to Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check for data list of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists in the transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Troubleshooting, Data List Reference Table <Super Select 4WD> ).
  • Item No. 10: T/F position
OK:
  • 2H (Drive mode-selector position: 2H)
  • 4H (Drive mode-selector position: 4H)
  • 4HLc (Drive mode-selector position: 4HLc)
  • 4LLc (Drive mode-selector position: 4LLc)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Perform the transfer-ECU diagnosis code procedure (Refer to GROUP 22A - Troubleshooting, Code No. C1430: Transfer position switch <Super select 4WD> ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 5. Retest the system
When you set the drive mode-selector to "4HLc" or "4LLc", "GRAVEL" should appear on the multi-information display in the combination meter.
Is the check result normal?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 6 .
 
STEP 6. Retest the system
When you set the drive mode-selector to "4HLc" or "4LLc", "GRAVEL" should appear on the multi-information display in the combination meter.
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > SYMPTOM PROCEDURES > Off-road mode is not switched by operating the off-road mode selector.<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION>
Inspection Procedure 21: The Off-road Mode is Not Switched Among "GRAVEL", "MUD/SNOW", "SAND" and "ROCK" by Operating the Off-road Mode Selector. <Vehicles with HDC Function>
 
 
caution
  • If there is any problem in the CAN bus lines, an incorrect diagnosis code may be set. Prior to this diagnosis, diagnose the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ).
  • Whenever ECU is replaced, ensure that the CAN bus lines are normal.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
OPERATION
ON and OFF signals of the off-road mode selector are sent to ASTC-ECU from the gateway-ECU via CAN bus line.
 
 
COMMENTS ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
  • The off-road mode selector input circuit fails.
  • The off-road mode is not switched among "GRAVEL", "MUD/SNOW", "SAND", "ROCK" when you operate the off-road mode selector under any of the following conditions: A warning notice is displayed on the multi-information display in the combination meter.
    1. Rear differential lock system: Lock
    2. Drive mode-selector: "2H" or "4H"
    3. The brake pads are hot.
    4. The ASTC-ECU detects a malfunction.
    5. The FCM is activated
  • When the off-road mode selector is pressed for 15 seconds or more, or the off-road mode selector is being pressed for long time in a certain condition such as something is put onto the off-road mode selector.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • When the ASTC-ECU stores the condition in which the off-road mode selector is being pressed for long time
  • Damaged wiring harness or connector
  • Malfunction of off-road mode selector
  • Malfunction of the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Restart the off-road mode
ASTC-ECU stores the condition, in which the off-road mode selector is being pressed for long time, when the off-road mode selector is being pressed for 15 seconds or more, or the off-road mode selector is being pressed for long time in a certain condition such as something is put onto the off-road mode selector. If you operate the switch in the condition above, off-road mode can not be turned ON/OFF, so perform the following procedures to clear the off-road mode selector condition, in which the off-road mode selector is being pressed for long time, stored in the ASTC-ECU.
(1) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(2) Restart the engine.
(3) Is the off-road mode selector switched among "GRAVEL", "MUD/SNOW", "SAND", "ROCK" when you operate the off-road mode selector under any of the following conditions?
  • Drive mode-selector: "4HLc" or "4LLc"
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the off-road mode switched by operating the off-road mode selector?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use the M.U.T.-III to diagnose the CAN bus lines.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the CAN bus lines (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Retest the system
Is the off-road mode selector switched among "GRAVEL", "MUD/SNOW", "SAND", "ROCK" when you operate the off-road mode selector under any of the following conditions?
  • Drive mode-selector: "4HLc" or "4LLc"
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any diagnosis code set?
Perform the troubleshooting for the diagnosis code (Refer to Diagnosis Code Chart ). Then go to Step 8.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check off-road mode selector itself
Check off-road mode selector itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the off-road mode selector (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8.
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to Data List Reference Table ).
  • Item No. 37: Off-road control changing SW
OK:
  • ON (When the off-road mode selector is　pushed)
  • OFF (When the off-road mode selector is not pushed)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Perform the gateway-ECU input signal procedure {Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <Gateway (for GW-CAN-C)>, Input Signal Procedures, Inspection Procedure 3: The off-road mode selector signal is not received }. Then go to Step 8 .
 
STEP 7. Retest the system
Is the off-road mode selector switched among "GRAVEL", "MUD/SNOW", "SAND", "ROCK" when you operate the off-road mode selector under any of the following conditions?
  • Drive mode-selector: "4HLc" or "4LLc"
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the check result normal?
The trouble can be an intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunction ).
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) (Refer to ). Then go to Step 8 .
 
STEP 8. Retest the system
Is the off-road mode selector switched among "GRAVEL", "MUD/SNOW", "SAND", "ROCK" when you operate the off-road mode selector under any of the following conditions?
  • Drive mode-selector: "4HLc" or "4LLc"
  • Rear differential lock system: Unlock
Is the check result normal?
This diagnosis is complete.
Return to Step 1.

The system is normal.

  • For vehicles without the system of each item, the data item is displayed but the data differs from the actual vehicle condition is displayed.
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > ACTUATOR TEST REFERENCE TABLE
ACTUATOR TEST TABLE
Using M.U.T.-III, the following actuators can be forcibly operated:
note
  • ABS and ASTC are operated by ASTC-ECU.
  • When ASTC-ECU is disabled due to the fail-safe function, the actuator test cannot be performed.
  • The actuator test can be performed only when the vehicle is stationary.
  • While the actuator test is performed, the ABS warning lamp flashes at a rate of 2 Hz.
  • After the actuator test has been performed, the brake warning lamp, ABS warning lamp, ASTC indicator lamp, and ASTC OFF indicator lamp illuminate until the ignition switch is turned to "ON" position again or the communication between M.U.T.-III and ASTC-ECU is terminated.

 
 
 
 
Actuator test specifications
Item No.Check itemDriven component
01FL wheel ABS driveSolenoid valve for the corresponding channel of the hydraulic unit and pump motor (simplified inspection mode)
02FR wheel ABS drive
03RL wheel ABS drive
04RR wheel ABS drive
05FL wheel TCL drive
06FR wheel TCL drive
07RL wheel TCL drive
08RR wheel TCL drive
09Engine TCL DriveSends the engine torque control signal (engine torque = 0 N·m) to the engine-ECU for 3 seconds.
10ESS test modeThe ASTC-ECU requests the ETACS-ECU to activate the ESS and then the ETACS-ECU flashes the hazard warning lamps quickly.
11Stop lamp test mode (TSA)The ASTC-ECU turns on the stop lamp relay to illuminate the stop lamps and the high-mounted stop lamp.
 
 
Operation pattern of item Nos. 01 to 08
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > TROUBLESHOOTING > CHECK AT ECU TERMINAL

1. Do not disconnect the ASTC-ECU connector, and measure the voltages between earth terminal No. 13 or No. 38 and each respective terminal.
2. The terminal layout is shown in the illustration.

Continuity Check at Wiring Harness-side Connector
1. Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
2. Disconnect the ASTC-ECU connector.
3. Check the resistance and continuity between the terminals indicated in the table below.
4. The terminal layout is shown in the illustration.
Terminal No.SignalNormal condition
13 to body earthEarthContinuity exists (2 Ω or less)
38 to body earthEarthContinuity exists (2 Ω or less)
 
 
 
 
STEERING WHEEL SENSOR
 
 
Terminal Voltage Check
1. Do not disconnect the steering wheel sensor connector, and measure the voltages between each respective terminal and body earth.
2. The terminal layout is shown in the illustration.
Terminal No.Terminal codeCheck itemChecking requirementsNormal condition
1----
2IG1Steering wheel sensor power supply(IG1)Ignition switch: "ON" position Battery voltage
Ignition switch: "LOCK" (OFF) position1 V or less
3CANHCAN bus line--

5----
 
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > ON-VEHICLE SERVICE > WHEEL SPEED SENSOR OUTPUT CURRENT MEASUREMENT
WHEEL SPEED SENSOR OUTPUT CURRENT MEASUREMENT
 
 
The relevant wheel, on which the wheel speed sensor is fitted, should be free to run.
1. Remove the wheel speed sensor connector to be checked.
2.
cautionFor precise measurement, do not connect to the wheel speed sensor-side connector and the wiring harness side connector terminal No.1.
Use the special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect a multimeter between the wheel speed sensor-side connector and the wiring harness connector terminal No.2.
3. Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
4.
cautionDo not rotate the wheel too quickly. Output current changes significantly as the wheel speed detection magnetic encoder comes near or goes away from the wheel speed sensor.
Rotate the wheel, on which the wheel speed sensor is fitted, quite slowly to measure the output current with the multimeter.
Standard value: 5 to 9 mA or 11 to 17 mA (Alternate output current changes)
5. If the measurement is not within the standard value, or the output current does not change in proportion to the wheel rotation, replace the wheel speed sensor (Refer to ).
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > ON-VEHICLE SERVICE > STOP LAMP RELAY CHECK
STOP LAMP RELAY CHECK
 
Battery voltageTerminal numberNormal condition
At no energisation2 - 5Continuity exists (2 ohms or less)
With current supply [terminal 1 (+), terminal 3 (-)]No continuity
At no energisation2 - 4No continuity
With current supply [terminal 1 (+), terminal 3 (-)]Continuity exists (2 ohms or less)
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > ON-VEHICLE SERVICE > HYDRAULIC UNIT CHECK
HYDRAULIC UNIT (HU) CHECK
1.
caution
  • The roller of the braking force tester and the tyre should be dry during testing.
  • When testing the front brakes, apply the parking brake. When testing the rear brakes, stop the front wheels with chocks.
Jack up the vehicle. Then support the vehicle with rigid racks at the specified jack-up points or place the front or rear wheels on the rollers of the braking force tester.
2. Release the parking brake, and feel the drag force (drag torque) on each road wheel. When using the braking force tester, take a reading of the brake drag force.
3.
cautionBefore connecting or disconnecting M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Before setting M.U.T.-III, turn the ignition key to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
4. After checking that the selector lever is in neutral, start the engine.
5. When carrying out the actuator tests No.01 to 04, perform the actuator tests using M.U.T.-III while depressing the brake pedal. When carrying out the actuator tests No.05 to 08, perform the actuator tests using M.U.T.-III without depressing the brake pedal. When carrying out the actuator tests, rotate the wheel by hands to confirm that the braking force changes.
note
  • When ASTC-ECU is disabled due to the fail-safe function, the M.U.T.-III actuator test cannot be performed.
  • After the actuator test has been performed, the ABS warning lamp and brake waning lamp illuminate until the ignition switch is turned to "ON" again or the communication between M.U.T.-III and ASTC-ECU is terminated.
6.
This is indicated as shown in the above.
7. When any malfunction has been found, take a necessary action according to the "Judgement Table."
Judgement Table
Display on M.U.T.-IIIOperationTest resultJudgementCauseMeasure
01 FL wheel ABS drive
02 FR wheel ABS drive
03 RL wheel ABS drive
04 RR wheel ABS drive
  • Depress the brake pedal to lock the wheel.
  • Select the vehicle to be inspected using M.U.T.-III, perform the actuator test.
  • Rotate the selected wheel by hands to confirm the braking force.
Braking force decreases for 3 seconds from the lock status.Normal--
The wheel does not lock even if the brake pedal is depressed.ErrorClogged brake line other than hydraulic unitCheck and clean the brake line.
Clogged hydraulic circuit in the hydraulic unitReplace the hydraulic unit assembly.
Braking force does not decrease.Faulty routing of hydraulic unit brake tubeRoute the brake tube correctly.
Malfunction of hydraulic unit solenoid valve operationReplace the hydraulic unit assembly.
05 FL wheel TCL drive
06 FR wheel TCL drive
07 RL wheel TCL drive
08 RR wheel TCL drive
  • Select the vehicle to be inspected using M.U.T.-III, perform the actuator test.
  • Rotate the selected wheel by hands to confirm the braking force.
Lock condition occurs for 3 seconds from the status without braking force.Normal--
The wheel does not lock.Error
  • Faulty routing of hydraulic unit brake tube
  • Clogged brake line other than hydraulic unit
Check and clean the brake line.
Clogged hydraulic circuit in the hydraulic unitReplace the hydraulic unit assembly.
8. After the inspection, turn the ignition switch to the LOCK (OFF) position, and then disconnect M.U.T.-III.
 
 
 
 
Hydraulic unit installation adjustment
Refer to .
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > ON-VEHICLE SERVICE > REMEDY FOR A DISCHARGED BATTERY
MEASURES FOR DISCHARGED BATTERY
cautionBecause the vehicle posture when applying the brakes becomes unstable, do not leave ABS/ASC disabled (for example, ASTC-ECU connector disconnection).
When starting the engine using a booster cable with the battery fully discharged, if you begin driving the vehicle before the battery is fully charged, the engine misfire may occur and you cannot start the vehicle. This is because ABS/ASC consumes more electric current to perform the self-check. In this case, charge the battery fully.
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > ON-VEHICLE SERVICE > CALIBRATION
CALIBRATION
 
 
ALL SENSOR CALIBRATION
caution
  • If the ASTC-ECU sets the diagnosis code other than No. C1392, C1393 and C1394 before calibration, follow the relevant troubleshooting procedure.
  • When the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor.
  • Carry out the calibration under the following conditions.
    • The vehicle has one occupant (driver) only.
    • Turn the steering wheel to set the wheels in the straight-ahead positions.
    • The brake pedal is not depressed. (The stop lamp switch is OFF.)
1. Park the vehicle on a level surface.
2. Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
3. Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
4.
cautionBefore connecting or disconnecting M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Before setting M.U.T.-III, turn the ignition key to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
5. Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
6. Select "ABS/ASC/ASTC/WSS."
7. Select "Special function."
8. Select "Sensor calibration."
9. Select "All sensor calibration."
10. Before removing M.U.T.-III from the vehicle, turn the ignition key to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
 
 
 
STEERING WHEEL SENSOR CALIBRATION
caution
  • If any of the following operations has been carried out, follow the two operations below:
    • Front wheel alignment
    • Column switch (integrated with steering wheel sensor) is replaced or removed and installed
    • The hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced
    1. Update the neutral position stored in the steering wheel sensor.
    2. Reset the correction value of the steering wheel angle, which is stored in the ASTC-ECU.
  • If the ASTC-ECU sets the diagnosis code other than No. C1392, C1393 and C1394 before calibration, follow the relevant troubleshooting procedure.
1. Park the vehicle on a level surface.
2. Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
3. Turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
4.
cautionBefore connecting or disconnecting M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Before setting M.U.T.-III, turn the ignition key to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
5. Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
6. Select "Steering angle sensor."
7. Select "Special function."
8. Select "SAS Calibration."
9. Select and run "SAS Initialization." (Reusable parts only)
note
  • Since the neutral position stored in the steering wheel sensor is no longer available, "SAS Initialization" is displayed.
  • Since a new steering wheel sensor has no neutral position, "SAS Calibration" is displayed.
10. Select and run "SAS Calibration."
11. Exit "Steering angle sensor" menu, and then select "ABS/ASC/ASTC/WSS."
12. Select "Special function."
13. Select "Sensor calibration."
14. Select "SAS calibration."
15. Before removing M.U.T.-III from the vehicle, turn the ignition key to the "LOCK" (OFF) position.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > ASC OFF SWITCH > ASC OFF SWITCH REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
Refer to GROUP 52A - Instrument Lower Panel
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > ASC OFF SWITCH > INSPECTION > ASC OFF SWITCH
ASTC OFF SWITCH CONTINUITY CHECK
1. As shown in the figure, connect the circuit tester to the ASTC OFF switch as a single unit.
2. Check the continuity status when the ASTC OFF switch is pressed and when the switch is released.
 
ItemWhen the ASTC OFF switch is released (Not being operated)When the ASTC OFF switch is pressed
Continuity between terminal No. 2 and No. 5No continuityContinuity exists (2 Ω or less)
Continuity between terminal No. 3 and No. 4Continuity existsContinuity exists
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > HYDRAULIC UNIT > HYDRAULIC UNIT REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
 
 
noteThe ASTC-ECU is integrated in the hydraulic unit.
cautionWhen the hydraulic unit (integrated with ASTC-ECU) is replaced, always carry out the calibration of the master cylinder pressure sensor, steering wheel sensor and the G and yaw rate sensor (Refer to ).
Pre-removal Operation
  • Brake Fluid Draining
  • Battery Removal (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery ) <L.H. drive vehicles>
  • Air Cleaner Removal (Refer to GROUP 15 - Air Cleaner )
Post-installation Operation
  • Brake Fluid Filling
  • Air Cleaner Installation (Refer to GROUP 15 - Air Cleaner )
  • Battery Installation (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery ) <L.H. drive vehicles>
  • Brake Line Bleeding (Refer to GROUP 35A - On-vehicle Service, Bleeding )
  • Hydraulic Unit Check (Refer to )
  • All Sensor Calibration (Refer to )
Removal steps
1.Harness connector
>>A<<2.Brake tube and hydraulic unit assembly connection
3.Brake tube (MP)
4.Brake tube (MS)
5.Hydraulic unit assembly and hydraulic unit bracket assembly
6.Insulator
7.Collar
<<A>>8.Hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
9.Hydraulic unit bracket assembly
 
 
REMOVAL SERVICE POINT
 
 
<<A>> HYDRAULIC UNIT ASSEMBLY (INTEGRATED WITH ASTC-ECU) REMOVAL
caution
  • The hydraulic unit assembly is heavy. Use care when removing it.
  • The hydraulic unit cannot be disassembled. Never loosen its nuts or bolts.
  • Do not drop or shock the hydraulic unit.
  • Do not turn the hydraulic unit upside down or lay it on its side.
 
 
 
INSTALLATION SERVICE POINT
 
 
>>A<< BRAKE TUBE CONNECTION
1. Connect the tubes to the hydraulic unit assembly as shown in the illustration.
  1. From the master cylinder (primary)
  2. From the master cylinder (secondary)
  3. To the front brake (LH)
  4. To the rear brake (RH)
  5. To the rear brake (LH)
  6. To the front brake (RH)
2. Install the clips to the brake tube as shown in the illustration.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > WHEEL SPEED SENSOR > WHEEL SPEED SENSOR REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
 
 
Post-installation Operation
  • Wheel Speed Sensor Output Current Measurement (Refer to .)
Front wheel speed sensor removal steps
1.Bracket
2.Equip nut
<<A>>3.Front wheel speed sensor
4.Protector
•Front rotor (GROUP 26, Drive Shaft Assembly .)
Rear wheel speed sensor removal steps
5.Harness
<<A>>6.Rear wheel speed sensor
7.O-ring
•Rear rotor (Refer to GROUP 27, Axle Shaft Assembly .)
noteThe front rotor is integrated with the BJ assembly, which cannot be disassembled.
 
 
REMOVAL SERVICE POINT
 
 
<<A>> FRONT WHEEL SPEED SENSOR/REAR WHEEL SPEED SENSOR REMOVAL
cautionBe careful when handling the projection at the tip of the wheel speed sensor and the toothed edge of the rotor so as not to damage them by contacting other parts.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > WHEEL SPEED SENSOR > INSPECTION > WHEEL SPEED SENSOR INSPECTION
WHEEL SPEED SENSOR INSPECTION
 
 
WHEEL SPEED SENSOR CURRENT CHECK
1.
caution
  • Do not connect the battery terminals in reverse as the wheel speed sensor may be damaged.
  • When the current value is measured by the wheel speed sensor connector, measure it with the wheel speed sensor installed in the vehicle.
Connect the circuit tester to the wheel speed sensor using the special tool extra fine probe (MB992006), and measure the sensor current as a single unit.
Standard value: 5 to 9 mA or 11 to 17 mA
2. If the measurement value is not within the standard value range, replace the wheel speed sensor with a new one.

 
 
WHEEL SPEED SENSOR INSULATION CHECK
1. Connect the circuit tester to the wheel speed sensor using the special tool extra fine probe (MB992006), and measure the insulation resistance between the terminal No. 1/2 and the wheel speed sensor body as a single unit.
Standard value: 1.5 MΩ or more
2. If the insulation resistance is not within the standard value range, replace the wheel speed sensor with a new one.
 
 
 
 
TOOTHED ROTOR CHECK
Check whether the rotor teeth are broken or deformed. Replace the driveshaft assembly for the front side, or the retainer for the rear side, respectively, if the teeth are damaged or deformed.
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > STEERING WHEEL SENSOR > STEERING WHEEL SENSOR REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
Refer to GROUP 54A - Column Switch .
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > HILL DESCENT CONTROL SWITCH<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION> > HILL DESCENT CONTROL SWITCH REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
On how to remove and install the HDC switch, refer to GROUP 52A - Rear Floor Console Assembly Removal and Installation .
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > HILL DESCENT CONTROL SWITCH<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION> > HILL DESCENT CONTROL SWITCH INSPECTION
INSPECTION
 
 
HDC Switch Continuity Check
1. As shown in the figure, connect the circuit tester to the HDC switch as a single unit.
2. Check the continuity status when the HDC switch is pressed and when the switch is released.
 
ItemWhen the HDC switch is released (Not being operated)When the HDC switch is pressed
Continuity between terminal No. 3 and No. 6No continuityContinuity exists (2 Ω or less)
Continuity between terminal No. 4 and No. 5Continuity existsContinuity exists
 
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > OFF-ROAD MODE SELECTOR<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION> > OFF-ROAD MODE SELECTOR REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION
On how to remove and install the off-road mode selector, refer to GROUP 52A - Rear Floor Console Assembly Removal and Installation .
 
35 -SERVICE BRAKES > 35C-ACTIVE STABILITY & TRACTION CONTROL SYSTEM (ASTC) > OFF-ROAD MODE SELECTOR<VEHICLES WITH HDC FUNCTION> > OFF-ROAD MODE SELECTOR INSPECTION
INSPECTION
 
 
Off-road Mode Selector Continuity Check
1. As shown in the figure, connect the circuit tester to the off-road mode selector as a single unit.
2. Check the continuity status when the off-road mode selector is pressed and when the switch is released.
 
ItemWhen the off-road mode selector is released (Not being operated)When the off-road mode selector is pressed
Continuity between terminal No. 10 and No. 13No continuityContinuity exists (2 Ω or less)
Continuity between terminal No. 11 and No. 12Continuity existsContinuity exists
